Linking,\n} from 'react-native';\nimport { NativeStackNavigationProp } from '@react-navigation/native-stack';\nimport { useFocusEffect } from '@react-navigation/native';\nimport { Colors } from '../utils/colors';\nimport { useSubscription } from '../context/SubscriptionContext';\nimport { useAuth } from '../context/AuthContext';\nimport { revenueCatService } from '../services/revenueCatService';\nimport { PurchasesPackage } from 'react-native-purchases';\n\ntype Props = {\n  navigation: NativeStackNavigationProp<any>;\n};\n\nexport default function SubscriptionScreen({ navigation }: Props) {\n  const { subscription, hasActiveSubscription, refreshSubscription, offerings } = useSubscription();\n  const { user } = useAuth();\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);\n  const [packages, setPackages] = useState<PurchasesPackage[]>([]);\n  const [loadingTimeout, setLoadingTimeout] = useState(false);\n\n  // Refresh subscription data and load packages when screen comes into focus\n  useFocusEffect(\n    React.useCallback(() => {\n      refreshSubscription();\n      loadPackages();\n    }, [offerings])\n  );\n\n  // Set timeout for loading offerings\n  useEffect(() => {\n    const timer = setTimeout(() => {\n      if (packages.length === 0) {\n        console.log('⏰ Timeout waiting for offerings');\n        setLoadingTimeout(true);\n      }\n    }, 10000); // 10 seconds\n\n    return () => clearTimeout(timer);\n  }, [packages]);\n\n  const loadPackages = () => {\n    console.log('🔍 loadPackages called');\n    console.log('🔍 offerings:', offerings);\n    console.log('🔍 offerings?.current:', offerings?.current);\n\n    if (!offerings) {\n      console.log('❌ No offerings object available');\n      return;\n    }\n\n    if (!offerings?.current) {\n      console.log('❌ No current offering available');\n      console.log('🔍 All offerings:', Object.keys(offerings.all));\n      return;\n    }\n\n    const availablePackages = offerings.current.availablePackages;\n    setPackages(availablePackages);\n    console.log('✅ Loaded', availablePackages.length, 'packages from RevenueCat');\n    availablePackages.forEach((pkg, index) => {\n      console.log(`📦 Package ${index + 1}:`, pkg.identifier, pkg.product.identifier);\n    });\n  };\n\n  const getPackageDetails = (pkg: PurchasesPackage) => {\n    const isMonthly = pkg.identifier === 'monthly' || pkg.product.identifier.includes('monthly');\n\n    return {\n      id: pkg.identifier,\n      name: isMonthly ? 'Monthly Plan' : 'Yearly Plan',\n      price: pkg.product.priceString,\n      period: isMonthly ? '/month' : '/year',\n      savings: isMonthly ? null : 'Save $20/year',\n      features: isMonthly\n        ? [\n            'Access to all premium papers',\n            'Unlimited test attempts',\n            'Detailed performance analytics',\n            'New content added regularly',\n            'Cancel anytime',\n          ]\n        : [\n            'Everything in Monthly Plan',\n            'Best value - 2 months free',\n            'Priority support',\n            'Early access to new features',\n            'Exclusive study materials',\n          ],\n      popular: !isMonthly,\n      package: pkg,\n    };\n  };\n\n  const handlePurchase = async (pkg: PurchasesPackage) => {\n    if (!user) {\n      Alert.alert('Error', 'Please login to subscribe');\n      return;\n    }\n\n    const details = getPackageDetails(pkg);\n\n    Alert.alert(\n      'Confirm Subscription',\n      `Subscribe to ${details.name} for ${details.price}${details.period}?\\n\\n` +\n        (hasActiveSubscription\n          ? 'This will switch your current plan.'\n          : 'You will get instant access to all premium papers.'),\n      [\n        { text: 'Cancel', style: 'cancel' },\n        {\n          text: 'Subscribe',\n          onPress: async () => {\n            setLoading(true);\n            try {\n              const result = await revenueCatService.purchasePackage(pkg);\n\n              if (result.success) {\n                await refreshSubscription();\n\n                Alert.alert(\n                  'Welcome to Premium! 🎉',\n                  `You are now subscribed to the ${details.name}.\\n\\nAll premium papers are now unlocked!`,\n                  [\n                    {\n                      text: 'Start Learning',\n                      onPress: () => {\n                        if (navigation.canGoBack()) {\n                          navigation.goBack();\n                        }\n                      },\n                    },\n                  ]\n                );\n              }\n            } catch (error: any) {\n              // Handle specific errors\n              if (error.message === 'CANCELLED') {\n                // User cancelled, do nothing\n                return;\n              }\n\n              if (error.message === 'PAYMENT_PENDING') {\n                Alert.alert(\n                  'Payment Pending',\n                  'Your payment is being processed. You will get access once the payment is confirmed.'\n                );\n                return;\n              }\n\n              // Generic error\n              Alert.alert(\n                'Purchase Failed',\n                error.message || 'Failed to complete purchase. Please try again.'\n              );\n            } finally {\n              setLoading(false);\n            }\n          },\n        },\n      ]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleManageSubscription = () => {\n    if (!user) return;\n\n    const platformName = Platform.OS === 'ios' ? 'App Store' : 'Google Play';\n\n    Alert.alert(\n      'Manage Subscription',\n      `To manage or cancel your subscription, please visit your ${platformName} account settings.\\n\\nWould you like to open ${platformName} now?`,\n      [\n        { text: 'Cancel', style: 'cancel' },\n        {\n          text: `Open ${platformName}`,\n          onPress: () => {\n            if (Platform.OS === 'ios') {\n              Linking.openURL('https://apps.apple.com/account/subscriptions');\n            } else {\n              Linking.openURL('https://play.google.com/store/account/subscriptions');\n            }\n          },\n        },\n      ]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleRestorePurchases = async () => {\n    setLoading(true);\n    try {\n      const customerInfo = await revenueCatService.restorePurchases();\n      await refreshSubscription();\n\n      const hasActiveEntitlement = customerInfo.entitlements.active['premium_access'] !== undefined;\n\n      if (hasActiveEntitlement) {\n        Alert.alert(\n          'Success! 🎉',\n          'Your purchases have been restored successfully!\\n\\nYou now have access to all premium content.'\n        );\n      } else {\n        Alert.alert(\n          'No Purchases Found',\n          'No active subscriptions were found to restore.\\n\\nIf you believe this is an error, please contact support.'\n        );\n      }\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      Alert.alert(\n        'Restore Failed',\n        'Failed to restore purchases. Please try again or contact support if the problem persists.'\n      );\n    } finally {\n      setLoading(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <>\n      <ScrollView style={styles.container}>\n        <View style={styles.header}>\n          <Text style={styles.title}>Choose Your Plan</Text>\n          <Text style={styles.subtitle}>\n            Unlock all premium papers and master your French certification\n          </Text>\n        </View>\n\n        {hasActiveSubscription && subscription && (\n          <View style={styles.currentPlanCard}>\n            <Text style={styles.currentPlanBadge}>✓ Active</Text>\n            <Text style={styles.currentPlanTitle}>Current Plan</Text>\n            <Text style={styles.currentPlanName}>\n              {subscription.plan === 'monthly' ? 'Monthly' : subscription.plan === 'yearly' ? 'Yearly' : 'Premium'} Subscription\n            </Text>\n            {subscription.expirationDate && (\n              <Text style={styles.currentPlanExpiry}>\n                {subscription.willRenew ? 'Renews' : 'Expires'} on{' '}\n                {new Date(subscription.expirationDate).toLocaleDateString()}\n              </Text>\n            )}\n            <TouchableOpacity\n              style={styles.manageButton}\n              onPress={handleManageSubscription}\n            >\n              <Text style={styles.manageButtonText}>Manage Subscription</Text>\n            </TouchableOpacity>\n          </View>\n        )}\n\n        <View style={styles.plansContainer}>\n          {packages.length > 0 ? (\n            packages.map((pkg) => {\n              const plan = getPackageDetails(pkg);\n              return (\n                <View\n                  key={plan.id}\n                  style={[styles.planCard, plan.popular && styles.popularPlan]}\n                >\n                  {plan.popular && (\n                    <View style={styles.popularBadge}>\n                      <Text style={styles.popularBadgeText}>⭐ Most Popular</Text>\n                    </View>\n                  )}\n\n                  <Text style={styles.planName}>{plan.name}</Text>\n\n                  <View style={styles.priceContainer}>\n                    <Text style={styles.price}>{plan.price}</Text>\n                    <Text style={styles.period}>{plan.period}</Text>\n                  </View>\n\n                  {plan.savings && (\n                    <View style={styles.savingsBadge}>\n                      <Text style={styles.savingsText}>{plan.savings}</Text>\n                    </View>\n                  )}\n\n                  <View style={styles.featuresContainer}>\n                    {plan.features.map((feature, index) => (\n                      <View key={index} style={styles.featureRow}>\n                        <Text style={styles.checkmark}>✓</Text>\n                        <Text style={styles.featureText}>{feature}</Text>\n                      </View>\n                    ))}\n                  </View>\n\n                  <TouchableOpacity\n                    style={[\n                      styles.subscribeButton,\n                      plan.popular && styles.popularSubscribeButton,\n                    ]}\n                    onPress={() => handlePurchase(plan.package)}\n                    disabled={loading}\n                  >\n                    <Text\n                      style={[\n                        styles.subscribeButtonText,\n                        plan.popular && styles.popularSubscribeButtonText,\n                      ]}\n                    >\n                      {hasActiveSubscription ? 'Switch Plan' : 'Subscribe Now'}\n                    </Text>\n                  </TouchableOpacity>\n                </View>\n              );\n            })\n          ) : loadingTimeout || !offerings ? (\n            <View style={styles.loadingPackages}>\n              <Text style={styles.errorIcon}>⚠️</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.errorTitle}>Unable to Load Plans</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.errorText}>\n                {!offerings\n                  ? 'Subscription service is initializing. Please try again in a moment.'\n                  : 'We couldn\\'t load the subscription plans. Please check your internet connection and try again.'}\n              </Text>\n              <TouchableOpacity\n                style={styles.retryButton}\n                onPress={() => {\n                  setLoadingTimeout(false);\n                  refreshSubscription();\n                  loadPackages();\n                }}\n              >\n                <Text style={styles.retryButtonText}>Retry</Text>\n              </TouchableOpacity>\n            </View>\n          ) : (\n            <View style={styles.loadingPackages}>\n              <ActivityIndicator size=\"large\" color={Colors.primary} />\n              <Text style={styles.loadingPackagesText}>Loading plans...</Text>\n            </View>\n          )}\n        </View>\n\n style={styles.benefitIcon}>📚</Text>\n            <View style={styles.benefitContent}>\n              <Text style={styles.benefitTitle}>Comprehensive Content</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.benefitDescription}>\n                Access to all premium TEF practice papers covering every section\n              </Text>\n            </View>\n          </View>\n\n          <View style={styles.benefitTitle}>Unlimited Practice</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.benefitDescription}>\n                Take premium tests as many times as you want with no restrictions\n              </Text>\n            </View>\n          </View>\n        </View>\n\n        {/* Restore Purchases Button (Required for iOS) */}\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={styles.restoreButton}\n          onPress={handleRestorePurchases}\n          disabled={loading}\n        >\n          <Text style={styles.restoreButtonText}>Restore Purchases</Text>\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n\n        <View style={styles.footer}>\n          <Text style={styles.footerText}>\n            Subscriptions will auto-renew unless cancelled at least 24 hours before the end of Key Technical Concepts\n\n- **React Native with Expo SDK ~54.0.31** - Mobile app framework\n- **TypeScript** - Type-safe development\n- **Firebase Authentication** - Email/password, Google OAuth, Apple OAuth\n- **Firebase Firestore** - User data and progress storage\n- **RevenueCat** - Subscription management (production keys: `goog_wfPOgySCOwvHBEZDfEzjYvJARDt`)\n- **React Navigation v6** - Stack and Tab navigation with beforeRemove listeners\n- **Google Sign-In SDK** - @react-native-google-signin/google-signin v16.1.1\n- **Apple Sign-In** - @invertase/react-native-apple-authentication\n- **EAS Build** - Expo Application Services for building AAB files\n- **Android App Bundle (AAB)** - Required format for Google Play Store\n- **OAuth 2.0** - Google and Apple authentication with SHA key configuration\n- **GitHub Pages** - Hosting privacy policy and account deletion pages\n- **Google Play Console** - App distribution and subscription management\n- **Production SHA Keys** - Required for Google Sign-In in production builds\n- **Service Account JSON** - Required for RevenueCat integration with Google Play\n\n## 3. Files and Code Sections\n\n### src/screens/ChangePasswordScreen.tsx (Created)\n**Why Important:** Allows users with email/password accounts to change their password securely.\n\n**Key Implementation:**\n```typescript\nconst handleChangePassword = async () => {\n  // Validation\n  if (!currentPassword || !newPassword || !confirmPassword) {\n    Alert.alert('Error', 'Please fill in all fields');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  if (newPassword.length < 6) {\n    Alert.alert('Error', 'New password must be at least 6 characters long');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  if (newPassword !== confirmPassword) {\n    Alert.alert('Error', 'New passwords do not match');\n    return;\n  }\n\n  setLoading(true);\n  try {\n    // Re-authenticate with current password\n    const credential = EmailAuthProvider.credential(user.email, currentPassword);\n    await reauthenticateWithCredential(user, credential);\n    \n    // Update password\n    await updatePassword(user, newPassword);\n    \n    Alert.alert('Success', 'Your password has been updated successfully');\n  } catch (error: any) {\n    if (error.code === 'auth/wrong-password') {\n      Alert.alert('Error', 'Current password is incorrect');\n    }\n  }\n};\n```\n\n### src/screens/ForgotPasswordScreen.tsx (Created)\n**Why Important:** Handles password reset via Firebase email, with SSO detection to prevent inappropriate reset attempts.\n\n**Key Implementation:**\n```typescript\nconst handleResetPassword = async () => {\n  setLoading(true);\n  try {\n    // Check sign-in methods first\n    const signInMethods = await fetchSignInMethodsForEmail(auth, email);\n    \n    // If no sign-in methods, user doesn't exist\n    if (signInMethods.length === 0) {\n      Alert.alert('Account Not Found', \n        `No account exists with the email ${email}.`);\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Check if SSO user\n    const isSSOUser = signInMethods.some(method =>\n      method === 'google.com' || method === 'apple.com'\n    );\n    \n    if (isSSOUser) {\n      const ssoProvider = signInMethods.includes('google.com') ? 'Google' : 'Apple';\n      Alert.alert('SSO Account',\n        `This account uses ${ssoProvider} Sign-In. Your password is managed by ${ssoProvider}.`);\n      return;\n    }\n    \n    // Send reset email for email/password users\n    await sendPasswordResetEmail(auth, email);\n    Alert.alert('Email Sent', \n      `A password reset link has been sent to ${email}.`);\n  }\n};\n```\n\n### src/screens/ProgressScreen.tsx (Modified)\n**Why Important:** Fixed navigation issue where \"Go to Login\" button didn't work in guest mode.\n\n**Key Change:**\n```typescript\n// Before (broken):\n<TouchableOpacity\n  onPress={() => navigation.getParent()?.navigate('Login' as never)}\n>\n\n// After (fixed):\nconst { user, guestMode, logout } = useAuth(); // Added logout\n\n<TouchableOpacity\n  onPress={() => {\n    // Log out of guest mode, which will automatically show Login screen\n    logout();\n  }}\n>\n```\n\n### src/screens/ProfileScreen.tsx (Modified)\n**Why Important:** Updated support email and fixed guest mode navigation.\n\n**Changes:**\n1. Updated support email from `support@tefprep.com` to `akmgcorp@gmail.com`\n2. Fixed \"Go to Login\" button to call `logout()` instead of attempting cross-stack navigation\n\n### src/screens/SubscriptionScreen.tsx (Modified)\n**Why Important:** Added better error handling for when subscription plans fail to load.\n\n**Key Changes:**\n```typescript\nconst [loadingTimeout, setLoadingTimeout] = useState(false);\n\n// Added timeout detection\nuseEffect(() => {\n  const timer = setTimeout(() => {\n    if (packages.length === 0) {\n      setLoadingTimeout(true);\n    }\n  }, 10000); // 10 seconds\n  return () => clearTimeout(timer);\n}, [packages]);\n\n// Added detailed logging\nconst loadPackages = () => {\n  console.log('🔍 loadPackages called');\n  console.log('🔍 offerings:', offerings);\n  console.log('🔍 offerings?.current:', offerings?.current);\n  \n  if (!offerings) {\n    console.log('❌ No offerings object available');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  if (!offerings?.current) {\n    console.log('❌ No current offering available');\n    return;\n  }\n  \n  const availablePackages = offerings.current.availablePackages;\n  setPackages(availablePackages);\n};\n\n// Added error UI with retry button\n{loadingTimeout || !offerings ? (\n  <View style={styles.loadingPackages}>\n    <Text style={styles.errorIcon}>⚠️</Text>\n    <Text style={styles.errorTitle}>Unable to Load Plans</Text>\n    <Text style={styles.errorText}>\n      {!offerings\n        ? 'Subscription service is initializing.'\n        : 'We couldn\\'t load the subscription plans.'}\n    </Text>\n    <TouchableOpacity style={styles.retryButton} onPress={retryLogic}>\n      <Text style={styles.retryButtonText}>Retry</Text>\n    </TouchableOpacity>\n  </View>\n) : (\n  <ActivityIndicator />\n)}\n```\n\n### app.json (Modified)\n**Why Important:** Bumped version code for new build with fixes.\n\n**Change:**\n```json\n\"android\": {\n  \"package\": \"com.tefprep.pro\",\n  \"versionCode\": 2,  // Changed from 1 to 2\n}\n```\n\n### .env (Modified)\n**Why Important:** Updated from test keys to production RevenueCat keys for Google Play.\n\n**Changes:**\n```bash\n# Before:\nREVENUECAT_API_KEY_GOOGLE=test_xxxxx\n\n# After:\nREVENUECAT_API_KEY_GOOGLE=goog_wfPOgySCOwvHBEZDfEzjYvJARDt\n```\n\n### privacy-policy.html (Created)\n**Why Important:** Required by Google Play Store. Hosted on GitHub Pages at https://ankur2911.github.io/tefprep-pro-privacy/\n\n**Key Sections:**\n- Data collection (email, name, test results)\n- Third-party services (Firebase, RevenueCat, Google/Apple Sign-In)\n- User rights (access, deletion, portability)\n- Contact email: akmgcorp@gmail.com\n\n### delete-account.html (Created)\n**Why Important:** Required by Google Play Store data safety requirements. Provides users with clear instructions to delete their account.\n\n**Key Features:**\n- In-app deletion instructions\n- Email deletion request option\n- 30-day deletion timeline\n- Subscription cancellation guidance\n\n### src/navigation/AppNavigator.tsx (Modified Multiple Times)\n**Why Important:** Fixed React Hooks error and navigation issues after authentication.\n\n**Final Working Version:**\n```typescript\nexport default function AppNavigator() {\n  const { user, loading, guestMode } = useAuth();\n  const isAuthenticated = !!(user || guestMode);\n  const prevAuthRef = React.useRef(isAuthenticated);\n\n  // MUST be before any conditional returns (React Hooks rule)\n  React.useEffect(() => {\n    if (isAuthenticated && !prevAuthRef.current) {\n      console.log('🔵 User just authenticated');\n    }\n    prevAuthRef.current = isAuthenticated;\n  }, [isAuthenticated]);\n\n  if (loading) {\n    return <LoadingScreen />;\n  }\n\n  return (\n    <Stack.Navigator screenOptions={{ headerShown: false }}>\n      {isAuthenticated ? (\n        <>\n          <Stack.Screen name=\"Main\" component={MainTabs} />\n          <Stack.Screen name=\"Subscription\" component={SubscriptionScreen} />\n        </>\n      ) : (\n        <Stack.Screen name=\"Login\" component={LoginScreen} />\n      )}\n    </Stack.Navigator>\n  );\n}\n```\n\n### src/context/AuthContext.tsx (Modified)\n**Why Important:** Fixed logout to properly sign out from Google SDK.\n\n**Key Fix:**\n```typescript\nconst logout = async () => {\n  // Logout from RevenueCat\n  try {\n    await revenueCatService.logoutUser();\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('Failed to logout from RevenueCat:', error);\n  }\n  \n  // Sign out from Google (removed isSignedIn check - doesn't exist in v16.1.1)\n  try {\n    await GoogleSignin.signOut();\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.log('ℹ️ Google sign out skipped');\n  }\n  \n  // Sign out from Firebase\n  await signOut(auth);\n  \n  // Clear guest mode\n  setGuestMode(false);\n};\n```\n\n### eas.json (Modified)\n**Why Important:** Configured production build to generate AAB format required by Google Play.\n\n**Configuration:**\n```json\n{\n  \"build\": {\n    \"production\": {\n      \"android\": {\n        \"buildType\": \"app-bundle\"  // Creates .aab instead of .apk\n      }\n    }\n  }\n}\n```\n\n### src/utils/mockData.ts (Read for content expansion)\n**Why Important:** Contains all mock exam questions. Currently has 16 papers with 10-40 questions each. User wants to expand this with 2 new comprehensive exams with 40+ questions each.\n\n**Current Structure:**\n```typescript\nexport const MOCK_QUESTIONS: { [paperId: string]: Question[] } = {\n  '1': [...], // 10 questions\n  '2': [...], // 10 questions\n  // ... etc\n};\n\nexport const MOCK_PAPERS: Paper[] = [\n  {\n    id: '1',\n    title: 'TEF Compréhension Orale - Niveau A1',\n    questionsCount: 10,\n    duration: 30,\n    isPremium: false,\n  },\n  // ... 15 more papers\n];\n```\n\n## 4. Errors and Fixes\n\n### Error 1: Guest Mode Activating After Google Sign-In\n**Issue:** After successful Google Sign-In, guest mode was being activated instead of showing authenticated state.\n\n**Root Cause:** The \"Continue as Guest\" button was somehow being triggered after authentication completed.\n\n**Fix Applied:**\n1. Added `authSuccess` state to track when authentication completes\n2. Added protection in `handleGuestMode` to check if auth is in progress\n3. Disabled guest button when `loading || ssoLoading || authSuccess || user` exists\n4. Added cleanup effect to reset state on unmount\n\n**User Feedback:** User confirmed issue was fixed after these changes.\n\n### Error 2: Navigation Stuck on LoginScreen After Authentication\n**Issue:** After successful Google Sign-In, app remained on LoginScreen instead of navigating to Main screen.\n\n**Root Cause:** LoginScreen was included in BOTH authenticated and unauthenticated stacks, causing navigation confusion.\n\n**Fix Applied:**\n1. Removed Login screen from authenticated stack\n2. Simplified stack configuration\n3. Let React Navigation automatically show first screen when stack config changes\n\n**User Feedback:** User confirmed navigation worked after rebuild.\n\n### Error 3: React Hooks Order Error\n**Issue:** App crashed with: \"React has detected a change in the order of Hooks called by AppNavigator\"\n\n**Root Cause:** `useEffect` hook was placed AFTER a conditional return statement, violating React's Rules of Hooks.\n\n**Fix Applied:**\n```typescript\n// Before (broken):\nif (loading) {\n  return <LoadingScreen />; // Early return\n}\nReact.useEffect(() => { ... }); // Hook called conditionally!\n\n// After (fixed):\nReact.useEffect(() => { ... }); // All hooks first\nif (loading) {\n  return <LoadingScreen />; // Then conditional returns\n}\n```\n\n**User Feedback:** Error disappeared after fix.\n\n### Error 4: GoogleSignin.isSignedIn is Not a Function\n**Issue:** Logout failed with: `GoogleSignin.isSignedIn is not a function (it is undefined)`\n\n**Root Cause:** The `isSignedIn()` method doesn't exist in version 16.1.1 of the Google Sign-In SDK.\n\n**Fix Applied:**\n```typescript\n// Before (broken):\nconst isSignedIn = await GoogleSignin.isSignedIn();\nif (isSignedIn) {\n  await GoogleSignin.signOut();\n}\n\n// After (fixed):\ntry {\n  await GoogleSignin.signOut(); // Just call signOut directly\n} catch (error) {\n  console.log('ℹ️ Google sign out skipped');\n}\n```\n\n**User Feedback:** Logout worked after this fix.\n\n### Error 5: Google Sign-In Failing in Production Build\n**Issue:** Google Sign-In worked in development but failed when tester installed from Play Store (version 1).\n\n**Root Cause:** Development SHA keys were configured in Firebase/Google Cloud, but production builds use different SHA keys from Play Store signing.\n\n**Fix Applied:**\n1. Retrieved production SHA keys from Google Play Console → App Integrity → App signing\n   - SHA-1: `6A:5B:CD:F5:8F:F1:D5:96:4A:6C:2B:66:3C:61:38:E6:37:72:23:EB`\n   - SHA-256: `F8:BF:D7:C5:63:85:7A:E1:1D:EB:F4:D4:72:25:31:72:54:FC:A1:D3:E1:E8:92:59:F6:0A:A2:00:D7:7C:99:7D`\n2. Added both to Firebase Console → Project Settings → Android app → SHA certificate fingerprints\n3. Added SHA-1 to Google Cloud Console → Credentials → OAuth 2.0 Client ID for Android\n4. Created version 2 build with updated configuration\n\n**User Feedback:** Waiting for tester to update to version 2 to confirm fix.\n\n### Error 6: Guest Mode \"Go to Login\" Button Not Working\n**Issue:** When in guest mode, clicking \"Go to Login\" button in ProgressScreen or ProfileScreen did nothing.\n\n**Root Cause:** Trying to navigate from authenticated stack (where guest mode users are) to unauthenticated stack (where Login screen is) doesn't work with `navigation.getParent()?.navigate()`.\n\n**Fix Applied:**\n```typescript\n// Changed from attempting cross-stack navigation to logging out of guest mode\n<TouchableOpacity\n  onPress={() => {\n    logout(); // This automatically shows Login screen\n  }}\n>\n```\n\n**User Feedback:** Fix included in version 2 build.\n\n### Error 7: Subscription Plans Not Loading\n**Issue:** SubscriptionScreen showed \"Loading plans...\" indefinitely without displaying subscription options.\n\n**Root Cause:** User was testing with version 1, which was built BEFORE RevenueCat was successfully connected to Google Play. The offerings API couldn't load products that weren't properly configured yet.\n\n**Fix Applied:**\n1. Added better error handling with timeout (10 seconds)\n2. Added detailed logging to diagnose issues\n3. Added error UI with retry button\n4. Explained that version 2 (with proper RevenueCat connection) should fix this\n\n**User Feedback:** User acknowledged they were testing with version 1 and will test version 2 when approved.\n\n### Error 8: EAS Secret Command Deprecated\n**Issue:** Command `eas secret:delete --scope project --name REVENUECAT_API_KEY_GOOGLE` returned \"This command is deprecated. question: 'Quel temps après \"dès que\" dans un contexte futur?',","+      options: ['Présent', 'Futur', 'Imparfait', 'Conditionnel'],","+      correctAnswer: 1,","+      explanation: '\"Dès que\" {","+      id: 'q17_41',","+      question: 'Complétez: \"Les livres ___ j\\'ai besoin sont épuisés.\"',","+      options: ['qui', 'que', 'dont', 'où'],","+      correctAnswer: 2,","+      explanation: '\"Avoir besoin de\" → \"dont\" (de + relatif).',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_42',","+      question: 'Quel est le participe passé de \"courir\"?',","+      options: ['Couru', 'Courru', 'Couri', 'Courri'],","+      correctAnswer: 0,","+      explanation: 'Le participe passé de \"courir\" est \"couru\".',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_43',","+      question: 'Complétez: \"Il faut que nous ___ plus attention.\"',","+      options: ['faisons', 'fassions', 'ferons', 'ferions'],","+      correctAnswer: 1,","+      explanation: 'Après \"il faut que\", subjonctif: \"fassions\".',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_44',","+      question: 'Quel pronom: \"Je pense à mes parents\" → \"J\\'y pense / Je ___ pense\"',","+      options: ['les', 'leur', 'y', 'en'],","+      correctAnswer: 2,","+      explanation: '\"Penser à\" (chose/lieu) → \"y\"; \"penser à\" (personne) → pas de pronom simple ou \"penser à eux\".',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_45',","+      question: 'Complétez: \"Elles se sont ___ des lettres.\"',","+      options: ['écrit', 'écrites', 'écrite', 'écrits'],","+      correctAnswer: 0,","+      explanation: 'COD \"des lettres\" après le verbe → pas d\\'accord.',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_46',","+      question: 'Quelle préposition: \"Je viens ___ France.\"',","+      options: ['de', 'du', 'de la', 'des'],","+      correctAnswer: 0,","+      explanation: 'Avec pays féminin: \"de France\" (pas d\\'article).',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_47',","+      question: 'Complétez: \"Voici la personne ___ le fils est médecin.\"',","+      options: ['qui', 'que', 'dont', 'où'],","+      correctAnswer: 2,","+      explanation: '\"Le fils de la personne\" → \"dont le fils\".',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_48',","+      question: 'Quel temps: \"Si j\\'avais su, je ___ venu.\"',","+      options: ['viendrais', 'serais venu', 'viendrai', 'suis venu'],","+      correctAnswer: 1,","+      explanation: 'Hypothèse irréelle passé: Si + plus-que-parfait + conditionnel passé.',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_49',","+      question: 'Complétez: \"Je les ai ___ hier.\" (voir, femmes)',","+      options: ['vu', 'vue', 'vus', 'vues'],","+      correctAnswer: 3,","+      explanation: 'COD \"les\" (féminin pluriel) avant le verbe → \"vues\".',","+    },","+    {","+      id: 'q17_50',","+      question: 'Quelle négation: \"Je ne vois ___ personne.\"',","+      options: ['pas', 'plus', 'jamais', 'rien'],","+      correctAnswer: 0,","+      explanation: '\"Ne...personne\" (pas besoin de \"pas\"); mais si la phrase est \"Je ne vois pas personne\", c\\'est une double négation (oral familier).',","+    },","+  ],","+","+  // Paper 18: TEF Complete Simulation - Niveau A2  papersUploaded: number;\n    questionsUploaded: number;\n    errors?: number;\n  } | null>(null);\n\n  // Check if user is admin\n  const userIsAdmin = isAdmin(user?.email);\n\n  // If not admin, show access denied\n  if (!userIsAdmin) {\n    return (\n      <View style={styles.accessDeniedContainer}>\n        <Text style={styles.accessDeniedIcon}>🚫</Text>\n        <Text </TouchableOpacity>\n      </View>\n    );\n  }\n\n  const handleUploadData = async () => {\n    Alert.alert(\n      'Upload Mock Data',\n      'This will upload all 16 papers and their questions to onPress: async () => {\n            try {\n              setUploading(true);\n              setUploadResult(null);\n              const result = await uploadMockDataToFirebase();\n              setUploadResult({\n                papersUploaded: result.papersUploaded,\n                questionsUploaded: result.questionsUploaded,\n                errors: result.errors,\n              });\n\n Questions: ${result.questionsUploaded}\\n⚠️ Errors: ${result.errors}\\n\\nIf you see \"Missing permissions\" errors, you need to update your Firebase security rules.\\n\\nCheck the console for details.`,\n                  [\n                    {\n                      text: 'View Instructions',\n                      onPress: () => Alert.alert(\n                        'Fix Firebase Rules',\n                        'Go to Firebase Console → Firestore Database → Rules\\n\\nAdd this rule:\\n\\nmatch /papers/{paperId}/questions/{questionId} {\\n  allow read: if true;\\n  allow write: if request.auth != null;\\n}\\n\\nSee FIREBASE_RULES_FIX.md for complete instructions.'\n                      )\n                    },\n                    { text: 'OK' }\n                  ]\n                );\n              } else {\n                Alert.alert(\n                  'Upload Successful!',\n                  `✓ Uploaded ${result.papersUploaded} papers\\n✓ Uploaded ${result.questionsUploaded} questions\\n\\nAll data is now in Firebase!`\n                );\n              }\n            } catch (error: any) {\n              console.error('Upload error:', error);\n              const errorMsg = error?.message || 'Unknown error';\n              Alert.alert(\n                'Upload Failed',\n                `Error: ${errorMsg}\\n\\nCheck the console for more details.`,\n                [{ text: 'OK' }]\n              );\n            } finally {\n              setUploading(false);\n            }\n          },\n        },\n      ]\n    );\n  };\n\n This action cannot be undone!',\n      [\n        { text: 'Cancel', style: 'cancel' },\n        {\n          text: 'Delete',\n          style: 'destructive',\n          onPress: async () => {\n            try {\n              setClearing(true);\n              await clearFirebaseData();\n              setUploadResult(null);\n              Alert.alert('Success', 'All data cleared from Firebase');\n            } catch (error) {\n              console.error('Clear error:', error);\n              Alert.alert('Error', 'Failed to clear data. Check console for details.');\n            } finally {\n              setClearing(false);\n            }\n          },\n        },\n      ]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleTestRules = async () => {\n    try {\n      setTesting(true);\n      console.log('\\n🔍 Starting Firebase rules test...\\n');\n      const result = await testFirebaseRules();\n\n      if (result.questionWrite) {\n        Alert.alert(\n          '✓ Rules Test Passed',\n          'All Firebase security rules are configured correctly!\\n\\nYou can now upload mock data without errors.',\n          [{ text: 'OK' }]\n        );\n      } else {\n        Alert.alert(\n          '✗ Rules Test Failed',\n          'Your Firebase rules are not configured correctly.\\n\\nThe questions subcollection cannot be written to.\\n\\nCheck the console for detailed instructions.',\n          [\n            {\n              text: 'Show Fix',\n              onPress: () => {\n                getCurrentFirebaseRulesInfo();\n                Alert.alert(\n                  'Fix Instructions',\n                  'Full instructions printed to console.\\n\\nGo to:\\nFirebase Console → Firestore Database → Rules\\n\\nThen copy the rules from the console.',\n                  [{ text: 'OK' }]\n                );\n              }\n            },\n            { text: 'OK' }\n          ]\n        );\n      }\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      console.error('Test error:', error);\n      Alert.alert('Test Error', error?.message || 'Unknown error');\n    } finally {\n      setTesting(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const handleShowRules = () => {\n    getCurrentFirebaseRulesInfo();\n    Alert.alert(\n      'Firebase Rules',\n      'Complete Firebase security rules have been printed to the console.\\n\\nTo apply:\\n\\n1. Paste and Publish',\n      [{ text: 'OK' }]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleSyncCurrentUser = async () => {\n    if (!user) {\n      Alert.alert('Error', 'No user logged in');\n      return;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      setSyncing(true);\n\n      // Check if user document already exists\n      const exists = await checkUserDocumentExists(user.uid);\n\n      if (exists) {\n        Alert.alert(\n          'Already Synced',\n          `Your user document already exists in Firestore.\\n\\nEmail: ${user.email}\\nUID: ${user.uid.substring(0, 12)}...`,\n          [{ text: 'OK' }]\n        );\n        return;\n      }\n\n      // Sync user\n      await syncCurrentUser(user.uid, user.email || '');\n\n      Alert.alert(\n        'Success!',\n        `Your account has been synced to Firestore.\\n\\nYou can now:\\n• View your account in User Management\\n• Toggle test premium for yourself\\n• Access all admin features`,\n        [{ text: 'OK' }]\n      );\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      console.error('Sync error:', error);\n      Alert.alert('Error', error?.message || 'Failed to sync user');\n    } finally {\n      setSyncing(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <ScrollView style={styles.container}>\n      <View style={styles.header}>\n        <Text style={styles.headerTitle}>Admin Panel</Text>\n        <Text style={styles.headerSubtitle}>Manage Firebase Data</Text>\n      </View>\n\n      <View style={styles.section}>\n        <Text style={styles.sectionTitle}>Diagnostics</Text>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.diagnosticButton, syncing && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleSyncCurrentUser}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing || syncing}\n        >\n          {syncing ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>🔍</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Test Firebase Rules</Text>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={styles.infoButton}\n          onPress={handleShowRules}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing || syncing}\n        >\n          <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>📋</Text>\n          <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Show Correct Rules</Text>\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n      </View>\n\n      <View style={styles.section}>\n        <Text style={styles.sectionTitle}>Data Management</Text>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.actionButton, uploading && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleUploadData}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing}\n        >\n          {uploading ? Upload all papers with their original IDs\n * 2. Add questions to each paper as a subcollection\n * 3. Add delays to avoid bandwidth limits\n */\nexport const uploadMockDataToFirebase = async () => {\n  try {\n    console.log('Starting upload of mock data to Firebase...');\n    console.log('This will take a few minutes to avoid bandwidth limits...\\n');\n\n    let uploadedPapers = 0;\n    let uploadedQuestions = 0;\n    const errors: string[] = [];\n\n    // Upload papers one at a time with delays\n    for (let i = 0; i < MOCK_PAPERS.length; i++) {\n      const paper = MOCK_PAPERS[i];\n\n      try {\n        // Use the paper's ID as the document ID\n        const paperRef = doc(db, 'papers', paper.id);\n\n        // Upload paper data (without questions array)\n        await setDoc(paperRef, {\n          title: paper.title,\n          description: paper.description,\n          category: paper.category,\n          difficulty: paper.difficulty,\n          duration: paper.duration,\n          questionsCount: paper.questionsCount,\n          thumbnail: paper.thumbnail,\n          isPremium: paper.isPremium,\n        });\n\n        uploadedPapers++;\n        console.log(`✓ [${i + 1}/${MOCK_PAPERS.length}] Uploaded paper ${paper.id}: ${paper.title}`);\n\n        // Add delay after paper upload\n        await delay(500);\n\n        // Upload questions for this paper if they exist\n        const questions = MOCK_QUESTIONS[paper.id];\n        if (questions && questions.length > 0) {\n          // Upload questions in smaller batches to avoid limits\n          const BATCH_SIZE = 10;\n          let questionBatchCount = 0;\n\n          for (let j = 0; j < questions.length; j += BATCH_SIZE) {\n            const batch = writeBatch(db);\n            const questionBatch = questions.slice(j, j + BATCH_SIZE);\n\n            questionBatch.forEach((question) => {\n              const questionRef = doc(db, 'papers', paper.id, 'questions', question.id);\n              batch.set(questionRef, {\n                question: question.question,\n                options: question.options,\n                correctAnswer: question.correctAnswer,\n                explanation: question.explanation,\n              });\n            });\n\n            await batch.commit();\n            questionBatchCount += questionBatch.length;\n\n            // Add delay between question batches\n            await delay(300);\n          }\n\n          uploadedQuestions += questionBatchCount;\n          console.log(`  ✓ Uploaded ${questionBatchCount} questions for paper ${paper.id}`);\n        }\n\n        // Add delay between papers\n        await delay(800);\n\n      } catch (error: any) {\n        const errorMsg = `Paper ${paper.id}: ${error?.message || 'Unknown error'}`;\n        errors.push(errorMsg);\n        console.error(`✗ Error uploading paper ${paper.id}:`, error?.message || error);\n\n        // If bandwidth error, wait longer before continuing\n        if (error?.code === 'resource-exhausted') {\n          console.log('  ⏳ Bandwidth limit hit, waiting 5 seconds...');\n          await delay(5000);\n        }\n      }\n    }\n\n    console.log('\\n=== Upload Summary ===');\n    console.log(`Papers uploaded: ${uploadedPapers}/${MOCK_PAPERS.length}`);\n    console.log(`Questions uploaded: ${uploadedQuestions}`);\n\n    if (errors.length > 0) {\n      console.log(`\\n⚠️  Errors encountered: ${errors.length}`);\n      errors.forEach(err => console.log(`  - ${err}`));\n    } else {\n      console.log('✓ Upload completed successfully!');\n    }\n\n    return {\n      success: errors.length === 0,\n      papersUploaded: uploadedPapers,\n      questionsUploaded: uploadedQuestions,\n      errors: errors.length,\n    };\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('Error uploading mock data:', error);\n    throw error;\n  }\n};\n\n/**\n * Delete all papers and questions from Firebase\n * Use with caution!\n */\nexport const clearFirebaseData = async () => {\n  try {\n    console.log('Clearing all papers from Firebase...');\n    const { getDocs, collection, deleteDoc } = await import('firebase/firestore');\n\n    const papersRef = collection(db, 'papers');\n    const snapshot = await getDocs(papersRef);\n\n    const batch = writeBatch(db);\n    snapshot.docs.forEach((doc) => {\n      batch.delete(doc.ref);\n    });\n\n    await batch.commit();\n    console.log(`Deleted ${snapshot.docs.length} papers`);\n\n    return { success: true, deleted: snapshot.docs.length };\n  } catch (error) {\n    console.error('Error clearing Firebase data:', error);\n    throw error;\n  }\n};\n","numLines":147,"startLine":1,"totalLines":147}},"sourceToolAssistantUUID":"c9e18456-1d07-44cf-873a-e4deba3d3991"}

ActivityIndicator,\n} from 'react-native';\nimport { NativeStackNavigationProp } from '@react-navigation/native-stack';\nimport { Colors } from '../utils/colors';\nimport { uploadMockDataToFirebase, clearFirebaseData } from '../scripts/uploadMockData';\nimport { testFirebaseRules, getCurrentFirebaseRulesInfo } from '../scripts/testFirebaseRules';\nimport { syncCurrentUser, checkUserDocumentExists NativeStackNavigationProp<any>;\n};\n\nexport default function AdminScreen({ navigation }: Props) {\n  const { user } = useAuth();\n  const [uploading, setUploading] = useState(false);\n  const [clearing, setClearing] = useState(false);\n  const [testing, setTesting] = useState(false);\n  const [syncing, setSyncing] = useState(false);\n  const [uploadResult, setUploadResult] = useState<{\n    papersUploaded: number;\n    questionsUploaded: number;\n    errors?: number;\n  } | null>(null);\n\n  // Check if user is admin\n  const userIsAdmin = isAdmin(user?.email);\n\n  // If not admin, show access denied\n  if (!userIsAdmin) {\n    return (\n      <View style={styles.accessDeniedContainer}>\n        <Text style={styles.accessDeniedIcon}>🚫</Text>\n        <Text style={styles.accessDeniedTitle}>Access Denied</Text>\n        <Text style={styles.accessDeniedText}>\n          You do not have permission to access the Admin Panel.\n        </Text>\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={styles.backButton}\n          onPress={() => navigation.goBack()}\n        >\n          <Text style={styles.backButtonText}>Go Back</Text>\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n      </View>\n    );\n  }\n\n  const handleUploadData = async () => {\n    Alert.alert(\n      'Upload Mock Data',\n      'This will upload all 16 papers and their questions to Firebase.\\n\\n⏱️ This will take 2-3 minutes to avoid bandwidth limits.\\n\\nContinue?',\n      [\n        { text: 'Cancel', style: 'cancel' },\n        {\n          text: 'Upload',\n          onPress: async () => {\n            try {\n              setUploading(true);\n              setUploadResult(null);\n              const result = await uploadMockDataToFirebase();\n              setUploadResult({\n                papersUploaded: result.papersUploaded,\n                questionsUploaded: result.questionsUploaded,\n                errors: result.errors,\n              });\n\n Questions: ${result.questionsUploaded}\\n⚠️ Errors: ${result.errors}\\n\\nIf you see \"Missing permissions\" errors, you need to update your Firebase security rules.\\n\\nCheck the console for details.`,\n                  [\n                    {\n                      text: 'View Instructions',\n                      onPress: () => Alert.alert(\n                        'Fix Firebase Rules',\n                        'Go to Firebase Console → Firestore Database → Rules\\n\\nAdd this rule:\\n\\nmatch /papers/{paperId}/questions/{questionId} {\\n  allow read: if true;\\n  allow write: if request.auth != null;\\n}\\n\\nSee FIREBASE_RULES_FIX.md for complete instructions.'\n                      )\n                    },\n                    { text: 'OK' }\n                  ]\n                );\n              } else {\n                Alert.alert(\n                  'Upload Successful!',\n                  `✓ Uploaded ${result.papersUploaded} papers\\n✓ Uploaded ${result.questionsUploaded} questions\\n\\nAll data is now in Firebase!`\n                );\n              }\n            } catch (error: any) {\n              console.error('Upload error:', error);\n              const errorMsg = error?.message || 'Unknown error';\n              Alert.alert(\n                'Upload Failed',\n                `Error: ${errorMsg}\\n\\nCheck the console for more details.`,\n                [{ text: 'OK' }]\n              );\n            } finally {\n              setUploading(false);\n            }\n          },\n        },\n      ]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleClearData = async () => {\n    Alert.alert(\n      'Clear Firebase Data',\n      'This will DELETE all papers and questions from Firebase. This action cannot be undone!',\n      [\n        { text: 'Cancel', style: 'cancel' },\n        {\n          text: 'Delete',\n          style: 'destructive',\n          onPress: async () => {\n            try {\n              setClearing(true);\n              await clearFirebaseData();\n              setUploadResult(null);\n              Alert.alert('Success', 'All data cleared from Firebase');\n            } catch (error) {\n              console.error('Clear error:', error);\n              Alert.alert('Error', 'Failed to clear data. Check console for details.');\n            } finally {\n              setClearing(false);\n            }\n          },\n        },\n      ]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleTestRules = async () => {\n    try {\n      setTesting(true);\n      console.log('\\n🔍 Starting Firebase rules test...\\n');\n      const result = await testFirebaseRules();\n\n      if (result.questionWrite) {\n        Alert.alert(\n          '✓ Rules Test Passed',\n          'All Firebase security rules are configured correctly!\\n\\nYou can now upload mock data without errors.',\n          [{ text: 'OK' }]\n        );\n      } else {\n        Alert.alert(\n          '✗ Rules Test Failed',\n          'Your Firebase rules are not configured correctly.\\n\\nThe questions subcollection cannot be written to.\\n\\nCheck the console for detailed instructions.',\n          [\n            {\n              text: 'Show Fix',\n              onPress: () => {\n                getCurrentFirebaseRulesInfo();\n                Alert.alert(\n                  'Fix Instructions',\n                  'Full instructions printed to console.\\n\\nGo to:\\nFirebase Console → Firestore Database → Rules\\n\\nThen copy the rules from the console.',\n                  [{ text: 'OK' }]\n                );\n              }\n            },\n            { text: 'OK' }\n          ]\n        );\n      }\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      console.error('Test error:', error);\n      Alert.alert('Test Error', error?.message || 'Unknown error');\n    } finally {\n      setTesting(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const handleShowRules = () => {\n    getCurrentFirebaseRulesInfo();\n    Alert.alert(\n      'Firebase Rules',\n      'Complete Firebase security rules have been printed to the console.\\n\\nTo apply:\\n\\n1. Check the console\\n2. Copy the rules\\n3. Go to Firebase Console\\n4. Firestore Database → Rules\\n5. Paste and Publish',\n      [{ text: 'OK' }]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleSyncCurrentUser = async () => {\n    if (!user) {\n      Alert.alert('Error', 'No user logged in');\n      return;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      setSyncing(true);\n\n      // Check if user document already exists\n      const exists = await checkUserDocumentExists(user.uid);\n\n      if (exists) {\n        Alert.alert(\n          'Already Synced',\n          `Your user document already exists in Firestore.\\n\\nEmail: ${user.email}\\nUID: ${user.uid.substring(0, 12)}...`,\n          [{ text: 'OK' }]\n        );\n        return;\n      }\n\n      // Sync user\n      await syncCurrentUser(user.uid, user.email || '');\n\n      Alert.alert(\n        'Success!',\n        `Your account has been synced to Firestore.\\n\\nYou can now:\\n• View your account in User Management\\n• Toggle test premium for yourself\\n• Access all admin features`,\n        [{ text: 'OK' }]\n      );\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      console.error('Sync error:', error);\n      Alert.alert('Error', error?.message || 'Failed to sync user');\n    } finally {\n      setSyncing(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <ScrollView style={styles.container}>\n      <View style={styles.header}>\n        <Text style={styles.headerTitle}>Admin Panel</Text>\n        <Text style={styles.headerSubtitle}>Manage Firebase Data</Text>\n      </View>\n\n      <View style={styles.section}>\n        <Text style={styles.sectionTitle}>Diagnostics</Text>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.diagnosticButton, syncing && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleSyncCurrentUser}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing || syncing}\n        >\n          {syncing ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>👤</Text>\n              <View style={{ flex: 1 }}>\n                <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Sync My Account to Firestore</Text>\n                <Text style={[styles.actionButtonText, { fontSize: 11, opacity: 0.8, fontWeight: '400' }]}>\n                  Required for User Management to see this user\n                </Text>\n              </View>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.diagnosticButton, testing && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleTestRules}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing || syncing}\n        >\n          {testing ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>🔍</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Test Firebase Rules</Text>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={styles.infoButton}\n          onPress={handleShowRules}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing || syncing}\n        >\n          <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>📋</Text>\n          <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Show Correct Rules</Text>\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n      </View>\n\n      <View style={styles.section}>\n        <Text style={styles.sectionTitle}>Data Management</Text>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.actionButton, uploading && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleUploadData}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing}\n        >\n          {uploading ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>📤</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Upload Mock Data to Firebase</Text>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.dangerButton, clearing && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleClearData}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing}\n        >\n          {clearing ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>🗑️</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Clear Firebase Data</Text>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n      </View>\n\n      {uploadResult && (\n        <View style={\n          uploadResult.errors && uploadResult.errors > 0\n            ?       <View style={styles.resultRow}>\n              <Text style={styles.resultLabel}>Errors:</Text>\n              <Text style={[styles.resultValue, { color: Colors.error }]}>\n                {String(uploadResult.errors)}\n              </Text>\n            </View>\n          )}\n        </View>\n      )}\n\n      <View style={styles.infoCard}>\n        <Text style={styles.infoTitle}>ℹ️ This action cannot be undone!',\n      [\n        { text: 'Cancel', style: 'cancel' },\n        {\n          text: 'Delete',\n          style: 'destructive',\n          onPress: async () => {\n            try {\n              setClearing(true);\n              await clearFirebaseData();\n              setUploadResult(null);\n              Alert.alert('Success', 'All data cleared from Firebase');\n            } catch (error) {\n              console.error('Clear error:', error);\n              Alert.alert('Error', 'Failed to clear data. Check console for details.');\n            } finally {\n              setClearing(false);\n            }\n          },\n        },\n      ]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleTestRules = async () => {\n    try {\n      setTesting(true);\n      console.log('\\n🔍 Starting Firebase rules test...\\n');\n      const result = await testFirebaseRules();\n\n      if (result.questionWrite) {\n        Alert.alert(\n          '✓ Rules Test Passed',\n          'All Firebase security rules are configured correctly!\\n\\nYou can now upload mock data without errors.',\n          [{ text: 'OK' }]\n        );\n      } else {\n        Alert.alert(\n          '✗ Rules Test Failed',\n          'Your Firebase rules are not configured correctly.\\n\\nThe questions subcollection cannot be written to.\\n\\nCheck the console for detailed instructions.',\n          [\n            {\n              text: 'Show Fix',\n              onPress: () => {\n                getCurrentFirebaseRulesInfo();\n                Alert.alert(\n                  'Fix Instructions',\n                  'Full instructions printed to console.\\n\\nGo to:\\nFirebase Console → Firestore Database → Rules\\n\\nThen copy the rules from the console.',\n                  [{ text: 'OK' }]\n                );\n              }\n            },\n            { text: 'OK' }\n          ]\n        );\n      }\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      console.error('Test error:', error);\n      Alert.alert('Test Error', error?.message || 'Unknown error');\n    } finally {\n      setTesting(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const handleShowRules = () => {\n    getCurrentFirebaseRulesInfo();\n    Alert.alert(\n      'Firebase Rules',\n      'Complete Firebase security rules have been printed to the console.\\n\\nTo apply:\\n\\n1. Check the console\\n2. Copy the rules\\n3. Go to Firebase Console\\n4. Firestore Database → Rules\\n5. Paste and Publish',\n      [{ text: 'OK' }]\n    );\n  };\n\n  const handleSyncCurrentUser = async () => {\n    if (!user) {\n      Alert.alert('Error', 'No user logged in');\n      return;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      setSyncing(true);\n\n      // Check if user document already exists\n      const exists = await checkUserDocumentExists(user.uid);\n\n      if (exists) {\n        Alert.alert(\n          'Already Synced',\n          `Your user document already exists in Firestore.\\n\\nEmail: ${user.email}\\nUID: ${user.uid.substring(0, 12)}...`,\n          [{ text: 'OK' }]\n        );\n        return;\n      }\n\n      // Sync user\n      await syncCurrentUser(user.uid, user.email || '');\n\n      Alert.alert(\n        'Success!',\n        `Your account has been synced to Firestore.\\n\\nYou can now:\\n• View your account in User Management\\n• Toggle test premium for yourself\\n• Access all admin features`,\n        [{ text: 'OK' }]\n      );\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      console.error('Sync error:', error);\n      Alert.alert('Error', error?.message || 'Failed to sync user');\n    } finally {\n      setSyncing(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <ScrollView style={styles.container}>\n      <View style={styles.header}>\n        <Text style={styles.headerTitle}>Admin Panel</Text>\n        <Text style={styles.headerSubtitle}>Manage Firebase Data</Text>\n      </View>\n\n      <View style={styles.section}>\n        <Text style={styles.sectionTitle}>Diagnostics</Text>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.diagnosticButton, syncing && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleSyncCurrentUser}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing || syncing}\n        >\n          {syncing ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>👤</Text>\n              <View style={{ flex: 1 }}>\n                <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Sync My Account to Firestore</Text>\n                <Text style={[styles.actionButtonText, { fontSize: 11, opacity: 0.8, fontWeight: '400' }]}>\n                  Required for User Management to see this user\n                </Text>\n              </View>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.diagnosticButton, testing && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleTestRules}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing || syncing}\n        >\n          {testing ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>🔍</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Test Firebase Rules</Text>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={styles.infoButton}\n          onPress={handleShowRules}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing || syncing}\n        >\n          <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>📋</Text>\n          <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Show Correct Rules</Text>\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n      </View>\n\n      <View style={styles.section}>\n        <Text style={styles.sectionTitle}>Data Management</Text>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.actionButton, uploading && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleUploadData}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing}\n        >\n          {uploading ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>📤</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Upload Mock Data to Firebase</Text>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n\n        <TouchableOpacity\n          style={[styles.dangerButton, clearing && styles.actionButtonDisabled]}\n          onPress={handleClearData}\n          disabled={uploading || clearing || testing}\n        >\n          {clearing ? (\n            <ActivityIndicator color={Colors.textInverse} />\n          ) : (\n            <>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonIcon}>🗑️</Text>\n              <Text style={styles.actionButtonText}>Clear Firebase Data</Text>\n            </>\n          )}\n        </TouchableOpacity>\n      </View>\n\n      {uploadResult && (\n        <View style={\n          uploadResult.errors && uploadResult.errors > 0\n            ? [styles.resultCard, styles.resultCardWarning]\n            : styles.resultCard\n        }>\n          <Text style={styles.resultTitle}>\n            {uploadResult.errors && uploadResult.errors > 0 ? '⚠️ Upload Result' : '✓ Upload Result'}\n          </Text>\n          <View style={styles.resultRow}>\n            <Text style={styles.resultLabel}>Papers Uploaded:</Text>\n            <Text style={styles.resultValue}>{String(uploadResult.papersUploaded)}</Text>\n          </View>\n          <View style={styles.resultRow}>\n            <Text style={styles.resultLabel}>Questions Uploaded:</Text>\n            <Text style={styles.resultValue}>{String(uploadResult.questionsUploaded)}</Text>\n          </View>\n          {uploadResult.errors && uploadResult.errors > 0 && (\n            <View style={styles.resultRow}>\n              <Text style={styles.resultLabel}>Errors:</Text>\n              <Text style={[styles.resultValue, { color: Colors.error }]}>\n                {String(uploadResult.errors)}\n              </Text>\n            </View>\n          )}\n        </View>\n      )}\n\n      <View style={styles.infoCard}>\n        <Text style={styles.infoTitle}>ℹ️ How to Use</Text>\n        <Text style={styles.infoText}>\n          1. <Text style={{ fontWeight: '600' }}>Sync My Account</Text> - Creates your user document in Firestore (required for User Skipping initialization. Subscriptions will not work until you add real API keys.');\n        this.isInitialized = false;\n        return;\n      }\n\n      // Configure SDK with debug logging in development\n      if console.log('ℹ️ User cancelled purchase');\n        throw new Error('CANCELLED');\n      }\n\n      // Check for payment pending (common on Android)\n      if (error.code === 'PAYMENT_PENDING_ERROR') (!user) return;\n\n    try {\n      const details = await revenueCatService.getSubscriptionDetails();\n      if (!details || !details.hasActiveSubscription) {\n        // User lost premium, update user document\n        await updateUserPremiumStatus(false);\n        return;\n      }\n\n      const now = new Date();\n      const expirationDate = details.expirationDate\n        ? new Date(details.expirationDate)\n        : new Date(now.getTime() + 30 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000); // Default 30 days\n\n      // Determine plan from product identifier\n      let plan: 'monthly' | 'yearly' = 'monthly';\n      if (details.productIdentifier?.includes('yearly')) {\n        plan = 'yearly';\n      }\n\n      const subscriptionData = {\n        userId: user.uid,\n        status: 'active',\n        plan,\n        startDate: Timestamp.fromDate(now),\n        endDate: Timestamp.fromDate(expirationDate),\n        autoRenew: details.willRenew,\n        productIdentifier: details.productIdentifier,\n        provider: 'revenuecat',\n        lastSynced: Timestamp.fromDate(now),\n      };\n\n      await setDoc(doc(db, 'subscriptions', user.uid), subscriptionData);\n\n      // Update isPremium flag in user document\n      await updateUserPremiumStatus(true);\n\n      console.log('✅ Synced subscription to Firestore');\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to sync to Firestore:', error);\n    }\n  };\n\n  // Fetch subscription from RevenueCat\n  const fetchSubscription = async () => {\n    if (!user) {\n      setSubscription(null);\n      setLoading(false);\n      return;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      // Admin gets automatic premium access\n      if (user.email === 'admin@tefprep.com') {\n        console.log('👑 Admin premium access granted automatically');\n        setSubscription({\n          hasActiveSubscription: true,\n          productIdentifier: 'admin_premium',\n          expirationDate: null,\n          willRenew: false,\n          plan: null,\n          isTestPremium: false,\n        });\n        setLoading(false);\n        return;\n      }\n\n      // Check for test premium flag in Firestore\n      const userDocRef = doc(db, 'users', user.uid);\n      const userDoc = await getDoc(userDocRef);\n      const isTestPremium = userDoc.exists() ? userDoc.data()?.testPremium === true : false;\n\n      if (isTestPremium) {\n        console.log('🧪 Test premium access enabled for user');\n        setSubscription({\n          hasActiveSubscription: true,\n          productIdentifier: 'test_premium',\n          expirationDate: null,\n          willRenew: false,\n          plan: null,\n          isTestPremium: true,\n        });\n        setLoading(false);\n        return;\n      }\n\n      const details = await revenueCatService.getSubscriptionDetails();\n\n      if (details) {\n        const plan = details.productIdentifier?.includes('yearly')\n          ? 'yearly'\n          : details.productIdentifier?.includes('monthly')\n            ? 'monthly'\n            : null;\n\n        setSubscription({\n          hasActiveSubscription: details.hasActiveSubscription,\n          productIdentifier: details.productIdentifier,\n          expirationDate: details.expirationDate,\n          willRenew: details.willRenew,\n          plan,\n          isTestPremium: false,\n        });\n\n        // Sync to Firestore if active\n        if (details.hasActiveSubscription) {\n          const customerInfo = await revenueCatService.getCustomerInfo();\n          if (customerInfo) {\n            await syncToFirestore(customerInfo);\n          }\n        } else {\n          // No active subscription, update user document\n          await updateUserPremiumStatus(false);\n        }\n      } else {\n        setSubscription(null);\n        await updateUserPremiumStatus(false);\n      }\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.warn('⚠️ Error fetching subscription - continuing without RevenueCat:', error);\n      // Don't block - just set no subscription\n      setSubscription(null);\n    } finally {\n      setLoading(false);\n    }\n  };\n\n  // Initialize RevenueCat and load offerings\n  useEffect(() => {\n    const initializeRevenueCat = async () => {\n      try {\n        // Initialize with user ID if available\n        await revenueCatService.initialize(user?.uid);\n\n        // Identify user if logged in\n        if (user) {\n          await revenueCatService.identifyUser(user.uid);\n        }\n\n        // Load offerings - don't block if this fails\n        const offers = await revenueCatService.getOfferings();\n        setOfferings(offers);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.warn('⚠️ RevenueCat initialization failed - continuing without subscriptions:', error);\n        // Don't block app - just set offerings to null\n        setOfferings(null);\n      }\n    };\n\n    // Don't await - let it run in background\n    initializeRevenueCat().catch(err => {\n      console.warn('⚠️ RevenueCat setup failed - app will continue without subscriptions');\n    });\n  }, [user]);\n\n  // Listen to subscription updates\n  useEffect(() => {\n    if (!user) {\n      setSubscription(null);\n      setLoading(false);\n      return;\n    }\n\n    // Initial fetch\n    fetchSubscription();\n\n    // Set up listener for purchase updates - but don't crash if RevenueCat isn't initialized\n    try {\n      Purchases.addCustomerInfoUpdateListener((customerInfo) => {\n        console.log('📱 Customer info updated from RevenueCat');\n        fetchSubscription();\n      });\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.warn('⚠️ Could not set up RevenueCat listener - continuing without it');\n    }\n\n    // Cleanup - RevenueCat doesn't require explicit removal\n    return () => {\n      // Listener is automatically cleaned up\n    };\n  }, [user]);\n\n  const hasActiveSubscription = subscription?.hasActiveSubscription ?? false;\n\n  const canAccessPaper = (isPremium: boolean) => {\n    if (!isPremium) return true;\n    return hasActiveSubscription;\n  };\n\n  const refreshSubscription = async () => {\n    await fetchSubscription();\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <SubscriptionContext.Provider\n      value={{\n        subscription,\n        loading,\n        hasActiveSubscription,\n        canAccessPaper,\n        refreshSubscription,\n        offerings,\n      }}\n    >\n      {children}\n    </SubscriptionContext.Provider>\n  );\n};\n\nexport const useSubscription = () => {\n  const context = useContext(SubscriptionContext);\n  if (!context) {\n    throw new Error('useSubscription must be used within a SubscriptionProvider');\n  }\n  return context;\n};\n","numLines":270,"startLine":1,"totalLines":270}},"sourceToolAssistantUUID":"42f0d2f1-9123-4fc5-8036-2288d42001f8"}
