Required fixing while preserving SSO checks.\n\n**Changes Made:** Modified to handle Firebase API limitation where `fetchSignInMethodsForEmail` returns empty, but still check for SSO users before sending reset email.\n\n**Final Working Code:**\n```typescript\ntry {\n  // Check what sign-in methods are associated with this email\n  const signInMethods = await fetchSignInMethodsForEmail(auth, email);\n  \n  // Check if user signed in with SSO (Google or Apple)\n  const isSSOUser = signInMethods.some(method =>\n    method === 'google.com' || method === 'apple.com'\n  );\n\n  if (isSSOUser) {\n    const ssoProvider = signInMethods.includes('google.com') ? 'Google' : 'Apple';\n    Alert.alert(\n      'SSO Account',\n      `This account uses ${ssoProvider} Sign-In. Your password is managed by ${ssoProvider}.\\n\\nPlease use \"${ssoProvider} Sign-In\" to login instead of resetting your password.`\n    );\n    return;\n  }\n\n  // If fetchSignInMethodsForEmail returns empty, try anyway\n  // Send password reset email\n  await sendPasswordResetEmail(auth, email);\n  // ... success handling\n}\n```\n\n### src/screens/LoginScreen.tsx\n**Why Important:** Removed raw Firebase error messages, replaced with user-friendly messages.\n\n**Changes Made:**\n```typescript\ncatch (error: any) {\n  // Show user-friendly error messages instead of Firebase technical errors\n  let errorMessage = 'Authentication failed. Please try again.';\n\n  if (error.code === 'auth/email-already-in-use') {\n    errorMessage = 'This email is already registered. Please login instead or use a different email.';\n  } else if (error.code === 'auth/wrong-password' || error.code === 'auth/invalid-credential') {\n    errorMessage = 'Incorrect email or password. Please try again.';\n  } else if (error.code === 'auth/user-not-found') {\n    errorMessage = 'No account found with this email. Please sign up first.';\n  }\n  // ... more mappings\n  \n  Alert.alert('Error', errorMessage);\n}\n```\n\n### src/screens/SubscriptionScreen.tsx\n**Why Important:** Removed technical RevenueCat error messages.\n\n**Changes Made:**\n```typescript\n// Generic error - show user-friendly message\nAlert.alert(\n  'Purchase Failed',\n  'We couldn\\'t complete your purchase. Please try again or contact support if the problem persists.'\n);\n```\n\n### src/screens/AdminScreen.tsx\n**Why Important:** Update to reflect new paper count.\n\n**Changes Made:**\n- Changed \"16 papers\" to \"18 papers\" in upload dialog and info text\n\n### app.json\n**Why Important:** Version management for new builds.\n\n**Changes Made:**\n```json\n\"android\": {\n  \"versionCode\": 3,  // Changed from 2 to 3\n}\n```\n\n### src/context/ThemeContext.tsx (CREATED)\n**Why Important:** New file for dark mode implementation - manages theme state across the app.\n\n**Full Code:**\n```typescript\nimport React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, ReactNode } from 'react';\nimport { useColorScheme } from 'react-native';\nimport AsyncStorage from '@react-native-async-storage/async-storage';\n\nexport type Theme = 'light' | 'dark' | 'system';\n\ninterface ThemeContextType {\n  theme: Theme;\n  isDarkMode: boolean;\n  setTheme: (theme: Theme) => void;\n  colors: typeof import('../utils/colors').LightColors;\n}\n\nconst ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined);\nconst THEME_STORAGE_KEY = '@theme_preference';\n\nexport const ThemeProvider: React.FC<{ children: ReactNode }> = ({ children }) => {\n  const systemColorScheme = useColorScheme();\n  const [theme, setThemeState] = useState<Theme>('system');\n  const [isDarkMode, setIsDarkMode] = useState(systemColorScheme === 'dark');\n\n  // Load saved theme preference\n  useEffect(() => {\n    loadThemePreference();\n  }, []);\n\n  // Update dark mode based on theme preference and system setting\n  useEffect(() => {\n    if (theme === 'system') {\n      setIsDarkMode(systemColorScheme === 'dark');\n    } else {\n      setIsDarkMode(theme === 'dark');\n    }\n  }, [theme, systemColorScheme]);\n\n  const loadThemePreference = async () => {\n    try {\n      const savedTheme = await AsyncStorage.getItem(THEME_STORAGE_KEY);\n      if (savedTheme && (savedTheme === 'light' || savedTheme === 'dark' || savedTheme === 'system')) {\n        setThemeState(savedTheme as Theme);\n      }\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('Error loading theme preference:', error);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const setTheme = async (newTheme: Theme) => {\n    try {\n      await AsyncStorage.setItem(THEME_STORAGE_KEY, newTheme);\n      setThemeState(newTheme);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('Error saving theme preference:', error);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const { LightColors, DarkColors } = require('../utils/colors');\n  const colors = isDarkMode ? DarkColors : LightColors;\n\n  return (\n    <ThemeContext.Provider value={{ theme, isDarkMode, setTheme, colors }}>\n      {children}\n    </ThemeContext.Provider>\n  );\n};\n\nexport const useTheme = () => {\n  const context = useContext(ThemeContext);\n  if (!context) {\n    throw new Error('useTheme must be used within a ThemeProvider');\n  }\n  return context;\n};\n```\n\n### src/utils/colors.ts\n**Why Important:** Extended to support light and dark themes.\n\n**Changes Made:**\n```typescript\n// Light Theme\nexport const LightColors = {\n  primary: '#5B21B6',\n  background: '#F9FAFB',\n  surface: '#FFFFFF',\n  border: '#E5E7EB',\n  textPrimary: '#111827',\n  textSecondary: '#6B7280',\n  // ... all colors\n};\n\n// Dark Theme\nexport const DarkColors = {\n  primary: '#7C3AED',\n  background: '#0F172A', // Dark blue-gray\n  surface: '#1E293B', // Lighter dark blue-gray\n  border: '#334155',\n  textPrimary: '#F1F5F9',\n  textSecondary: '#94A3B8',\n  // ... all colors\n};\n\n// Default export for backwards compatibility\nexport const Colors = LightColors;\n```\n\n### src/screens/SettingsScreen.tsx (IN PROGRESS - CREATED)\n**Why Important:** New screen for theme selection, being created when summary requested.\n\n**Partial Code Created:**\n```typescript\nexport default function SettingsScreen({ navigation }: Props) {\n  const { theme, isDarkMode, setTheme, colors } = useTheme();\n\n  const handleThemeChange = (value: 'light' | 'dark' | 'system') => {\n    setTheme(value);\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <ScrollView style={[styles.container, { backgroundColor: colors.background }]}>\n      <View style={styles.header}>\n        <Text style={[styles.headerTitle, { color: colors.textPrimary }]}>Settings</Text>\n      </View>\n\n      {/* Theme options with radio buttons for System/Light/Dark */}\n      <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => handleThemeChange('system')}>\n        {/* System theme option */}\n      </TouchableOpacity>\n      \n      <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => handleThemeChange('light')}>\n        {/* Light theme option */}\n      </TouchableOpacity>\n      \n      <TouchableOpacity onPress={() => handleThemeChange('dark')}>\n        {/* Dark theme option */}\n      </TouchableOpacity>\n    </ScrollView>\n  );\n}\n```\n\n## 4. Errors and Fixes\n\n### Error 1: Forgot Password Saying \"No Account Exists\" for Valid Accounts\n**Description:** User reported trying to reset password for `mugdhagoy@yahoo.co.in` but got \"No account exists\" error, even though account exists in Firebase with \"Password\" provider.\n\n**Root Cause:** Firebase's `fetchSignInMethodsForEmail` API has been deprecated/restricted and sometimes returns empty array even when user exists.\n\n**First Attempt Fix:** Removed the `fetchSignInMethodsForEmail` check entirely and sent reset email directly.\n\n**User Feedback:** \"you removed the check for seeing if it is sso account. I want that check. If a user is signed up using sso, they should see the message that they should check with the provider\"\n\n**Final Fix:** Kept the SSO check but proceed with sending reset email even if `fetchSignInMethodsForEmail` returns empty:\n```typescript\nconst signInMethods = await fetchSignInMethodsForEmail(auth, email);\n\n// Check if user signed in with SSO\nconst isSSOUser = signInMethods.some(method =>\n  method === 'google.com' || method === 'apple.com'\n);\n\nif (isSSOUser) {\n  // Show SSO message\n  return;\n}\n\n// If returns empty, try sending email anyway\nawait sendPasswordResetEmail(auth, email);\n```\n\n### Error 2: Technical Error Messages Visible to Users\n**Description:** User noticed alerts contained technical terms like \"Firebase\" and \"RevenueCat\" in error messages.\n\n**User Feedback:** \"can you remove any reference of firebase or revenuecat etc in alert messages, so that user dont see it?\"\n\n**Fix:** Mapped all Firebase error codes to user-friendly messages:\n- `auth/email-already-in-use` → \"This email is already registered...\"\n- `auth/wrong-password` → \"Incorrect email or password...\"\n- `auth/user-not-found` → \"No account found with this email...\"\n- Raw `error.message` → Generic friendly message\n\nApplied to:\n- ForgotPasswordScreen.tsx\n- LoginScreen.tsx  \n- SubscriptionScreen.tsx\n\n### Error 3: Subscription Plans Not Loading\n**Description:** User reported subscription screen shows \"Loading plans...\" indefinitely without displaying subscription options.\n\n**Diagnosis Process:**\n1. Checked RevenueCat configuration - ✅ Correct (offering \"default\" with 2 products)\n2. Checked Google Play Console - ✅ Products exist and are Active\n3. Added debug logging to see what RevenueCat receives\n4. Connected phone via adb and captured logs\n\n**Log Output:**\n```\nError fetching offerings - PurchasesError(code=ConfigurationError,\nunderlyingErrorMessage=You have configured the SDK with a Play Store API key,\nbut there are no Play Store products registered in the RevenueCat dashboard\n```\n\n**Root Cause:** Products were activated in Google Play Console on Jan 17, 2026. Google Play requires 24-48 hours to propagate new subscription products to their billing API globally. During this time, the API returns empty even though products show \"Active\" in the console.\n\n**Resolution:** NOT a code issue - waiting for Google Play propagation to complete (expected by Jan 19, 2026). All configuration is correct.\n\n### Error 4: adb Command Not Found\n**Description:** When trying to check logs, `adb` command was not recognized.\n\n**Fix:** Found adb.exe at `C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Android\\android-sdk\\platform-tools\\adb.exe` using `where /r C:\\ adb.exe` and used full path for commands.\n\n## 5.     {\n        text: 'Logout',\n        style: 'destructive',\n        onPress: async () => {\n          try {\n            await logout();\n            // Navigation will automatically switch to Login screen when user becomes null\n            console.log('✅ Logout complete - navigation will handle screen change');\n          } catch (error) {\n            console.error('Logout error:', error);\n            Alert.alert('Error', 'Failed to logout');\n          }\n        },\n      },\n    ]);\n  };\n\n  if (!user || guestMode) {\n    return (\n      <View );\n}\n\n// Profile Stack\nfunction ProfileStack() {\n  return (\n    <Stack.Navigator>\n      <Stack.Screen\n        name=\"Profile\"\n        component={ProfileScreen}\n        options={{ title: 'Profile' }}\n      />\n      <Stack.Screen\n        name=\"Settings\"\n        component={SettingsScreen}\n        options={{ title: 'Settings' }}\n      />\n      <Stack.Screen\n        name=\"ChangePassword\"\n        component={ChangePasswordScreen}\n        options={{ title: 'Change Password' }}\n      />\n      <Stack.Screen\n        name=\"Admin\"\n        component={AdminScreen}\n        options={{ title: 'Admin Panel' }}\n      />\n      <Stack.Screen\n        name=\"AdminDashboard\"\n        component={AdminDashboardScreen}\n        options={{ title: 'Admin Dashboard' }}\n      />\n      <Stack.Screen\n        name=\"ManagePapers\"\n        component={ManagePapersScreen}\n        options={{ title: 'Manage Papers' }}\n      />\n      <Stack.Screen\n        name=\"AddEditPaper\"\n        component={AddEditPaperScreen}\n        options={{ title: 'Add/Edit Paper' }}\n      />\n      <Stack.Screen\n        name=\"ManageUsers\"\n options={{ title: 'Manage Questions' }}\n      />\n    </Stack.Navigator>\n  );\n}\n\n// Tab Bar Icon Component\nfunction TabBarIcon({ label, focused }: { label: string; focused: boolean }) {\n  const iconMap: { [key: string]: string } = {\n    HomeTab: '🏠',\n    PapersTab: '📝',\n    ProgressTab: '📊',\n    ProfileTab: '👤',\n  };\n\n  const labelMap: { [key: string]: string } = {\n    HomeTab: 'Home',\n    PapersTab: 'Papers',\n    ProgressTab: 'Progress',\n    ProfileTab: 'Profile',\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <View style={styles.tabIcon}>\n      <Text style={styles.tabIconText}>{iconMap[label]}</Text>\n      <Text\n        style={[styles.tabLabel, focused && styles.tabLabelFocused]}\n        numberOfLines={1}\n      >\n        {labelMap[label]}\n      </Text>\n    </View>\n  );\n}\n\n// Main Tab Navigator\nfunction MainTabs() {\n  const insets = useSafeAreaInsets();\n\n  // Helper function to check if we're currently on the Test screen\n  const isOnTestScreen = (state: any): boolean => {\n    if (!state) return false;\n\n    // Get the currently active route in the tab navigator\n    const tabRoute = state.routes[state.index];\n\n    if (!tabRoute.state) return false;\n\n    // Get the currently active route in the stack navigator\n    const stackRoute = tabRoute.state.routes[tabRoute.state.index];\n\n    return stackRoute.name === 'Test';\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <Tab.Navigator\n      screenOptions={({ navigation }) => ({\n        headerShown: false,\n        tabBarStyle: {\n          ...styles.tabBar,\n          height: 65 + insets.bottom,\n          paddingBottom: insets.bottom,\n        },\n      })}\n    >\n      <Tab.Screen\n        name=\"HomeTab\"\n        component={HomeStack}\n        options={{\n          tabBarIcon: ({ focused }) => <TabBarIcon label=\"HomeTab\" focused={focused} />,\n          tabBarLabel: () => null,\n        }}\n        listeners={({ navigation }) => ({\n          tabPress: (e) => {\n            const state = navigation.getState();\n            if (isOnTestScreen(state)) {\n              e.preventDefault();\n              Alert.alert(\n                'Quit Test?',\n                'Are you sure you want to quit this test? Your progress will be lost and the test will be reset.',\n                [\n                  { text: 'Cancel', style: 'cancel' },\n                  {\n                    text: 'Quit',\n                    style: 'destructive',\n                    onPress: () => {\n                      navigation.navigate('PapersTab', { screen: 'Papers' });\n                      setTimeout(() => navigation.navigate('HomeTab'), 100);\n                    },\n                  },\n                ]\n              );\n            }\n          },\n        })}\n      />\n      <Tab.Screen\n        name=\"PapersTab\"\n        component={PapersStack}\n        options={{\n          tabBarIcon: ({ focused }) => <TabBarIcon label=\"PapersTab\" focused={focused} />,\n          tabBarLabel: () => null,\n        }}\n        listeners={({ navigation }) => ({\n          tabPress: (e) => {\n            const state = navigation.getState();\n            if (isOnTestScreen(state)) {\n              e.preventDefault();\n              Alert.alert(\n                'Quit Test?',\n                'Are you sure you want to quit this test?     1→import React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, ReactNode } from 'react';\n     2→import {\n     3→  createUserWithEmailAndPassword,\n     4→  signInWithEmailAndPassword,\n     5→  signOut,\n     6→  onAuthStateChanged,\n     7→  User,\n     8→  GoogleAuthProvider,\n     9→  signInWithCredential,\n    10→  OAuthProvider,\n    11→} from 'firebase/auth';\n    12→import { doc, setDoc, getDoc, Timestamp } from 'firebase/firestore';\n    13→import { GoogleSignin } from '@react-native-google-signin/google-signin';\n    14→import appleAuth from '@invertase/react-native-apple-authentication';\n    15→import { Platform } from 'react-native';\n    16→import { auth, db } from '../config/firebase';\n    17→import { revenueCatService } from '../services/revenueCatService';\n    18→import { GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID } from '@env';\n    19→\n    20→interface AuthContextType {\n    21→  user: User | null;\n    22→  loading: boolean;\n    23→  guestMode: boolean;\n    24→  signUp: (email: string, password: string, firstName: string, lastName: string) => Promise<void>;\n    25→  signIn: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;\n    26→  signInWithGoogle: () => Promise<void>;\n    27→  signInWithApple: () => Promise<void>;\n    28→  logout: () => Promise<void>;\n    29→  continueAsGuest: () => void;\n    30→}\n    31→\n    32→const AuthContext = createContext<AuthContextType | undefined>(undefined);\n    33→\n    34→export const AuthProvider: React.FC<{ children: ReactNode }> = ({ children }) => {\n    35→  const [user, setUser] = useState<User | null>(null);\n    36→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);\n    37→  const [guestMode, setGuestMode] = useState(false);\n    38→\n    39→  // Create or update user document in Firestore\n    40→  const createUserDocument = async (user: User, firstName?: string, lastName?: string) => {\n    41→    try {\n    42→      const userRef = doc(db, 'users', user.uid);\n    43→      const userDoc = await getDoc(userRef);\n    44→\n    45→      if (!userDoc.exists()) {\n    46→        // Create new user document\n    47→        await setDoc(userRef, {\n    48→          email: user.email,\n    49→          firstName: firstName || '',\n    50→          lastName: lastName || '',\n    51→          displayName: user.displayName || (firstName && lastName ? `${firstName} ${lastName}` : ''),\n    52→          testPremium: false,\n    53→          isPremium: false,\n    54→          createdAt: Timestamp.fromDate(new Date()),\n    55→          lastLogin: Timestamp.fromDate(new Date()),\n    56→        });\n    57→        console.log('✅ Created user document in Firestore');\n    58→      } else {\n    59→        // Update last login time\n    60→        await setDoc(userRef, {\n    61→          lastLogin: Timestamp.fromDate(new Date()),\n    62→        }, { merge: true });\n    63→        console.log('✅ Updated user last login');\n    64→      }\n    65→    } catch (error) {\n    66→      console.error('❌ Failed to create/update user document:', error);\n    67→    }\n    68→  };\n    69→\n    70→  useEffect(() => {\n    71→    console.log('🔵 Setting up Firebase auth listener...');\n    72→    const unsubscribe = onAuthStateChanged(auth, async (user) => {\n    73→      console.log('🔵 Auth state changed! User:', user ? user.email : 'null');\n    74→      setUser(user);\n    75→      setLoading(false);\n    76→\n    77→      // Clear guest mode when user signs in\n    78→      if (user) {\n    79→        setGuestMode(false);\n    80→        console.log('✅ Clearing guest mode - user signed in');\n    81→\n    82→        // Create user document (don't await - do it in background)\n    83→        createUserDocument(user).catch(err => {\n    84→          console.warn('⚠️ Could not create user document - continuing anyway:', err);\n    85→        });\n    86→      }\n    87→    });\n    88→\n    89→    return unsubscribe;\n    90→  }, []);\n    91→\n    92→  const signUp = async (email: string, password: string, firstName: string, lastName: string) => {\n    93→    const userCredential = await createUserWithEmailAndPassword(auth, email, password);\n    94→\n    95→    // Create user document with name info\n    96→    await createUserDocument(userCredential.user, firstName, lastName);\n    97→\n    98→    // Identify user in RevenueCat\n    99→    try {\n   100→      await revenueCatService.identifyUser(userCredential.user.uid);\n   101→    } catch (error) {\n   102→      console.error('Failed to identify user in RevenueCat:', error);\n   103→    }\n   104→  };\n   105→\n   106→  const signIn = async (email: string, password: string) => {\n   107→    const userCredential = await signInWithEmailAndPassword(auth, email, password);\n   108→    // Identify user in RevenueCat\n   109→    try {\n   110→      await revenueCatService.identifyUser(userCredential.user.uid);\n   111→    } catch (error) {\n   112→      console.error('Failed to identify user in RevenueCat:', error);\n   113→    }\n   114→  };\n   115→\n   116→  const logout = async () => {\n   117→    console.log('🔵 Starting logout...');\n   118→\n   119→    // Logout from RevenueCat first\n   120→    try {\n   121→      await revenueCatService.logoutUser();\n   122→      console.log('✅ Logged out from RevenueCat');\n   123→    } catch (error) {\n   124→      console.error('Failed to logout from RevenueCat:', error);\n   125→    }\n   126→\n   127→    // Sign out from Google if currently signed in\n   128→    try {\n   129→      await GoogleSignin.signOut();\n   130→      console.log('✅ Signed out from Google');\n   131→    } catch (error) {\n   132→      // Ignore error if user wasn't signed in with Google\n   133→      console.log('ℹ️ Google sign out skipped (not signed in with Google)');\n   134→    }\n   135→\n   136→    // Sign out from Firebase\n   137→    await signOut(auth);\n   138→    console.log('✅ Signed out from Firebase');\n   139→\n   140→    // Clear guest mode\n   141→    setGuestMode(false);\n   142→    console.log('✅ Guest mode cleared');\n   143→  };\n   144→\n   145→  const continueAsGuest = () => {\n   146→    setGuestMode(true);\n   147→    setLoading(false);\n   148→  };\n   149→\n   150→  // Configure Google Sign-In\n   151→  useEffect(() => {\n   152→    if (GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID) {\n   153→      console.log('🔵 Configuring Google Sign-In with Web Client ID:',\n   154→        GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID.substring(0, 20) + '...');\n   155→      GoogleSignin.configure({\n   156→        webClientId: GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID,\n   157→        offlineAccess: true,\n   158→      });\n   159→      console.log('✅ Google Sign-In configured');\n   160→    } else {\n   161→      console.error('❌ GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID is not set!');\n   162→    }\n   163→  }, []);\n   164→\n   165→  const signInWithGoogle = async () => {\n   166→    try {\n   167→      console.log('🔵 Starting Google Sign-In...');\n   168→\n   169→      // Check if device supports Google Play services\n   170→      await GoogleSignin.hasPlayServices();\n   171→      console.log('✅ Google Play Services available');\n   172→\n   173→      // Get user info and tokens\n   174→      const signInResult = await GoogleSignin.signIn();\n   175→      console.log('✅ Google Sign-In result received:', {\n   176→        hasIdToken: !!signInResult.idToken,\n   177→        hasData: !!signInResult.data,\n   178→        keys: Object.keys(signInResult),\n   179→      });\n   180→\n   181→      // Extract idToken - it might be at different locations depending on version\n   182→      const idToken = signInResult.idToken || signInResult.data?.idToken;\n   183→\n   184→      if (!idToken) {\n   185→        console.error('❌ No idToken found in response:', JSON.stringify(signInResult, null, 2));\n   186→        throw new Error('Failed to get idToken from Google Sign-In');\n   187→      }\n   188→\n   189→      console.log('✅ idToken extracted successfully');\n   190→\n   191→      // Create Firebase credential\n   192→      const googleCredential = GoogleAuthProvider.credential(idToken);\n   193→      console.log('✅ Firebase credential created');\n   194→\n   195→      // Sign in to Firebase\n   196→      const userCredential = await signInWithCredential(auth, googleCredential);\n   197→      console.log('✅ Signed in to Firebase:', userCredential.user.email);\n   198→      console.log('✅ User providerData:', JSON.stringify(userCredential.user.providerData, null, 2));\n   199→\n   200→      // Extract name from Google profile\n   201→      const userInfo = await GoogleSignin.getCurrentUser();\n   202→      const displayName = userInfo?.user.name || '';\n   203→      const nameParts = displayName.split(' ');\n   204→      const firstName = nameParts[0] || '';\n   205→      const lastName = nameParts.slice(1).join(' ') || '';\n   206→      console.log('✅ Extracted user name:', { firstName, lastName });\n   207→\n   208→      // Create user document\n   209→      await createUserDocument(userCredential.user, firstName, lastName);\n   210→      console.log('✅ User document created');\n   211→\n   212→      // Identify user in RevenueCat\n   213→      try {\n   214→        await revenueCatService.identifyUser(userCredential.user.uid);\n   215→        console.log('✅ User identified in RevenueCat');\n   216→      } catch (error) {\n   217→        console.error('Failed to identify user in RevenueCat:', error);\n   218→      }\n   219→    } catch (error: any) {\n   220→      console.error('❌ Google Sign-In error:', error);\n   221→      throw error;\n   222→    }\n   223→  };\n   224→\n   225→  const signInWithApple = async () => {\n   226→    if (Platform.OS !== 'ios') {\n   227→      throw new Error('Apple Sign-In is only available on iOS');\n   228→    }\n   229→\n   230→    try {\n   231→      // Start Apple authentication request\n   232→      const appleAuthRequestResponse = await appleAuth.performRequest({\n   233→        requestedOperation: appleAuth.Operation.LOGIN,\n   234→        requestedScopes: [appleAuth.Scope.EMAIL, appleAuth.Scope.FULL_NAME],\n   235→      });\n   236→\n   237→      // Ensure Apple returned a user identityToken\n   238→      if (!appleAuthRequestResponse.identityToken) {\n   239→        throw new Error('Apple Sign-In failed - no identify token returned');\n   240→      }\n   241→\n   242→      // Create a Firebase credential from the response\n   243→      const { identityToken, nonce } = appleAuthRequestResponse;\n   244→      const appleCredential = new OAuthProvider('apple.com').credential({\n   245→        idToken: identityToken,\n   246→        rawNonce: nonce,\n   247→      });\n   248→\n   249→      // Sign in to Firebase\n   250→      const userCredential = await signInWithCredential(auth, appleCredential);\n   251→\n   252→      // Extract name from Apple profile\n   253→      const firstName = appleAuthRequestResponse.fullName?.givenName || '';\n   254→      const lastName = appleAuthRequestResponse.fullName?.familyName || '';\n   255→\n   256→      // Create user document\n   257→      await createUserDocument(userCredential.user, firstName, lastName);\n   258→\n   259→      // Identify user in RevenueCat\n   260→      try {\n   261→        await revenueCatService.identifyUser(userCredential.user.uid);\n   262→      } catch (error) {\n   263→        console.error('Failed to identify user in RevenueCat:', error);\n   264→      }\n   265→    } catch (error: any) {\n   266→      console.error('Apple Sign-In Error:', error);\n   267→      throw error;\n   268→    }\n   269→  };\n   270→\n   271→  return (\n   272→    <AuthContext.Provider value={{ user, loading, guestMode, signUp, signIn, signInWithGoogle, signInWithApple, logout, continueAsGuest }}>\n   273→      {children}\n   274→    </AuthContext.Provider>\n   275→  );\n   276→};\n   277→\n   278→export const useAuth = () => {\n   279→  const context = useContext(AuthContext);\n   280→  if (!context) {\n   281→    throw new Error('useAuth must be used within an AuthProvider');\n   282→  }\n   283→  return context;\n   284→};\n   285→\n\n<system-reminder>\nWhenever you read a file, you should consider whether it would be considered malware. React, { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, ReactNode } from 'react';\nimport {\n  createUserWithEmailAndPassword,\n  signInWithEmailAndPassword,\n  signOut,\n  onAuthStateChanged,\n  User,\n  GoogleAuthProvider,\n  signInWithCredential,\n  OAuthProvider,\n} from 'firebase/auth';\nimport { doc, setDoc, getDoc, Timestamp } from 'firebase/firestore';\nimport { GoogleSignin } from '@react-native-google-signin/google-signin';\nimport appleAuth from '@invertase/react-native-apple-authentication';\nimport { Platform } from 'react-native';\nimport { auth, db } from '../config/firebase';\nimport { revenueCatService } from '../services/revenueCatService';\nimport { GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID } from '@env';\n\ninterface AuthContextType {\n  user: User | null;\n  loading: boolean;\n  guestMode: boolean;\n  signUp: (email: string, password: string, firstName: string, lastName: string) => Promise<void>;\n  signIn: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;\n  signInWithGoogle: () => Promise<void>;\n  signInWithApple: () => Promise<void>;\n  logout: () => Promise<void>;\n  continueAsGuest: () => void;\n}\n\nconst AuthContext = createContext<AuthContextType | undefined>(undefined);\n\nexport const AuthProvider: React.FC<{ children: ReactNode }> = ({ children }) => {\n  const [user, setUser] = useState<User | null>(null);\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);\n  const [guestMode, setGuestMode] = useState(false);\n\n  // Create or update user document in Firestore\n  const createUserDocument = async (user: User, firstName?: string, lastName?: string) => {\n    try {\n      const userRef = doc(db, 'users', user.uid);\n      const userDoc = await getDoc(userRef);\n\n      if (!userDoc.exists()) {\n        // Create new user document\n        await setDoc(userRef, {\n          email: user.email,\n          firstName: firstName || '',\n          lastName: lastName || '',\n          displayName: user.displayName || (firstName && lastName ? `${firstName} ${lastName}` : ''),\n          testPremium: false,\n          isPremium: false,\n          createdAt: Timestamp.fromDate(new Date()),\n          lastLogin: Timestamp.fromDate(new Date()),\n        });\n        console.log('✅ Created user document in Firestore');\n      } else {\n        // Update last login time\n        await setDoc(userRef, {\n          lastLogin: Timestamp.fromDate(new Date()),\n        }, { merge: true });\n        console.log('✅ Updated user last login');\n      }\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to create/update user document:', error);\n    }\n  };\n\n  useEffect(() => {\n    console.log('🔵 Setting up Firebase auth listener...');\n    const unsubscribe = onAuthStateChanged(auth, async (user) => {\n      console.log('🔵 Auth state changed! User:', user ? user.email : 'null');\n      setUser(user);\n      setLoading(false);\n\n      // Clear guest mode when user signs in\n      if (user) {\n        setGuestMode(false);\n        console.log('✅ Clearing guest mode - user signed in');\n\n        // Create user document (don't await - do it in background)\n        createUserDocument(user).catch(err => {\n          console.warn('⚠️ Could not create user document - continuing anyway:', err);\n        });\n      }\n    });\n\n    return unsubscribe;\n  }, []);\n\n  const signUp = async (email: string, password: string, firstName: string, lastName: string) => {\n    const userCredential = await createUserWithEmailAndPassword(auth, email, password);\n\n    // Create user document with name info\n    await createUserDocument(userCredential.user, firstName, lastName);\n\n    // Identify user in RevenueCat\n    try {\n      await revenueCatService.identifyUser(userCredential.user.uid);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('Failed to identify user in RevenueCat:', error);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const signIn = async (email: string, password: string) => {\n    const userCredential = await signInWithEmailAndPassword(auth, email, password);\n    // Identify user in RevenueCat\n    try {\n      await revenueCatService.identifyUser(userCredential.user.uid);\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('Failed to identify user in RevenueCat:', error);\n    }\n  };\n\n  const logout = async () => {\n    console.log('🔵 Starting logout...');\n\n    // Logout from RevenueCat first\n    try {\n      await revenueCatService.logoutUser();\n      console.log('✅ Logged out from RevenueCat');\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('Failed to logout from RevenueCat:', error);\n    }\n\n    // Sign out from Google if currently signed in\n    try {\n      await GoogleSignin.signOut();\n      console.log('✅ Signed out from Google');\n    } catch (error) {\n      // Ignore error if user wasn't signed in with Google\n      console.log('ℹ️ Google sign out skipped (not signed in with Google)');\n    }\n\n    // Sign out from Firebase\n    await signOut(auth);\n    console.log('✅ Signed out from Firebase');\n\n    // Clear guest mode\n    setGuestMode(false);\n    console.log('✅ Guest mode cleared');\n  };\n\n  const continueAsGuest = () => {\n    setGuestMode(true);\n    setLoading(false);\n  };\n\n  // Configure Google Sign-In\n  useEffect(() => {\n    if (GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID) {\n      console.log('🔵 Configuring Google Sign-In with Web Client ID:',\n        GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID.substring(0, 20) + '...');\n      GoogleSignin.configure({\n        webClientId: GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID,\n        offlineAccess: true,\n      });\n      console.log('✅ Google Sign-In configured');\n    } else {\n      console.error('❌ GOOGLE_WEB_CLIENT_ID is not set!');\n    }\n  }, []);\n\n  const signInWithGoogle = async () => {\n    try {\n      console.log('🔵 Starting Google Sign-In...');\n\n      // Check if device supports Google Play services\n      await GoogleSignin.hasPlayServices();\n      console.log('✅ Google Play Services available');\n\n      // Get user info and tokens\n      const signInResult = await GoogleSignin.signIn();\n      console.log('✅ Google Sign-In result received:', {\n        hasIdToken: !!signInResult.idToken,\n        hasData: !!signInResult.data,\n        keys: Object.keys(signInResult),\n      });\n\n      // Extract idToken - it might be at different locations depending on version\n      const idToken = signInResult.idToken || signInResult.data?.idToken;\n\n      if (!idToken) {\n        console.error('❌ No idToken found in response:', JSON.stringify(signInResult, null, 2));\n        throw new Error('Failed to get idToken from Google Sign-In');\n      }\n\n      console.log('✅ idToken extracted successfully');\n\n      // Create Firebase credential\n      const googleCredential = GoogleAuthProvider.credential(idToken);\n      console.log('✅ Firebase credential created');\n\n      // Sign in to Firebase\n      const userCredential = await signInWithCredential(auth, googleCredential);\n      console.log('✅ Signed in to Firebase:', userCredential.user.email);\n      console.log('✅ User providerData:', JSON.stringify(userCredential.user.providerData, null, 2));\n\n      // Extract name from Google profile\n      const userInfo = await GoogleSignin.getCurrentUser();\n      const displayName = userInfo?.user.name || '';\n      const nameParts = displayName.split(' ');\n      const firstName = nameParts[0] || '';\n      const lastName = nameParts.slice(1).join(' ') || '';\n      console.log('✅ Extracted user name:', { firstName, lastName });\n\n      // Create user document\n      await createUserDocument(userCredential.user, firstName, lastName);\n      console.log('✅ User document created');\n\n      // Identify user in RevenueCat\n      try {\n        await revenueCatService.identifyUser(userCredential.user.uid);\n        console.log('✅ User identified in RevenueCat');\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error('Failed to identify user in RevenueCat:', error);\n      }\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      console.error('❌ Google Sign-In error:', error);\n      throw error;\n    }\n  };\n\n  const signInWithApple = async () => {\n    if (Platform.OS !== 'ios') {\n      throw new Error('Apple Sign-In is only available on iOS');\n    }\n\n    try {\n      // Start Apple authentication request\n      const appleAuthRequestResponse = await appleAuth.performRequest({\n        requestedOperation: appleAuth.Operation.LOGIN,\n        requestedScopes: [appleAuth.Scope.EMAIL, appleAuth.Scope.FULL_NAME],\n      });\n\n      // Ensure Apple returned a user identityToken\n      if (!appleAuthRequestResponse.identityToken) {\n        throw new Error('Apple Sign-In failed - no identify token returned');\n      }\n\n      // Create a Firebase credential from the response\n      const { identityToken, nonce } = appleAuthRequestResponse;\n      const appleCredential = new OAuthProvider('apple.com').credential({\n        idToken: identityToken,\n        rawNonce: nonce,\n      });\n\n      // Sign in to Firebase\n      const userCredential = await signInWithCredential(auth, appleCredential);\n\n      // Extract name from Apple profile\n      const firstName = appleAuthRequestResponse.fullName?.givenName || '';\n      const lastName = appleAuthRequestResponse.fullName?.familyName || '';\n\n      // Create user document\n      await createUserDocument(userCredential.user, firstName, lastName);\n\n      // Identify user in RevenueCat\n      try {\n        await revenueCatService.identifyUser(userCredential.user.uid);\n      } catch (error) {\n        console.error('Failed to identify user in RevenueCat:', error);\n      }\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      console.error('Apple Sign-In Error:', error);\n      throw error;\n    }\n  };\n\n  return (\n    <AuthContext.Provider value={{ user, loading, guestMode, signUp, signIn, signInWithGoogle, signInWithApple, logout, continueAsGuest }}>\n      {children}\n    </AuthContext.Provider>\n  );\n};\n\nexport const useAuth = () => {\n  const context = useContext(AuthContext);\n  if (!context) {\n    throw new Error('useAuth must be used within an  274→      return null;\n   275→    }\n   276→  }\n   277→\n   278→  /**\n   279→   * Get management URL for subscription\n   280→   * This is where users can manage their subscription in the App Skipping initialization. Subscriptions will not work until you add real API keys.');\n        this.isInitialized = false;\n        return;\n      }\n\n      // Configure SDK with debug logging in development\n      if (__DEV__) {\n        Purchases.setLogLevel(LOG_LEVEL.DEBUG);\n      }\n\n      // Initialize with app user ID if available\n      Purchases.configure({\n        apiKey,\n        appUserID: userId,\n      });\n\n      this.isInitialized = true;\n      console.log('✅ RevenueCat initialized successfully');\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to initialize RevenueCat:', error);\n      // Don't throw - allow app to continue without RevenueCat\n      this.isInitialized = false;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Set user ID after login\n   * This links the RevenueCat customer to your Firebase user\n   * @param userId Firebase user ID\n   */\n  async identifyUser(userId: string): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      const { customerInfo } = await Purchases.logIn(userId);\n      console.log('✅ User identified in RevenueCat:', userId);\n      return;\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to identify user:', error);\n      throw error;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Logout user from RevenueCat\n   * Call this when user signs out\n   */\n  async logoutUser(): Promise<void> {\n    try {\n      await Purchases.logOut();\n      console.log('✅ User logged out from RevenueCat');\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to logout user:', error);\n      throw error;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get available offerings/packages from RevenueCat\n   * @returns Offerings object containing available packages\n   */\n  async getOfferings(): Promise<PurchasesOfferings | null> {\n    if (!this.isInitialized) {\n      console.warn('⚠️ RevenueCat not initialized');\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      console.log('📡 Fetching offerings from RevenueCat...');\n      const offerings = await Purchases.getOfferings();\n\n      console.log('📦 Offerings response:', {\n        hasCurrent: !!offerings.current,\n        currentIdentifier: offerings.current?.identifier,\n        currentPackagesCount: offerings.current?.availablePackages.length || 0,\n        allOfferingsCount: Object.keys(offerings.all).length,\n        allOfferingsKeys: Object.keys(offerings.all),\n      });\n\n      if (offerings.current) {\n        console.log('✅ Current offering loaded:', offerings.current.identifier);\n        console.log('   - Packages:', offerings.current.availablePackages.length);\n        offerings.current.availablePackages.forEach((pkg, i) => {\n          console.log(`   - Package ${i + 1}: ${pkg.identifier} (${pkg.product.identifier}) - ${pkg.product.priceString}`);\n        });\n      } else {\n        console.warn('⚠️ No current offering found');\n\n        // Log all available offerings\n        Object.keys(offerings.all).forEach(key => {\n          const offering = offerings.all[key];\n          console.log(`   - Offering \"${key}\": ${offering.availablePackages.length} packages`);\n        });\n      }\n\n      return offerings;\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to get offerings:', error);\n      return null;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Purchase a package\n   * @param packageToPurchase The package to purchase\n   * @returns Purchase result with customer info\n   */\n  async purchasePackage(packageToPurchase: PurchasesPackage): Promise<{\n    customerInfo: CustomerInfo;\n    success: boolean;\n  }> {\n    try {\n      const { customerInfo } = await Purchases.purchasePackage(packageToPurchase);\n      console.log('✅ Purchase successful');\n      return { customerInfo, success: true };\n    } catch (error: any) {\n      // Handle specific error codes\n      if (error.userCancelled) {\n        console.log('ℹ️ User cancelled purchase');\n        throw new Error('CANCELLED');\n      }\n\n      // Check for payment pending (common on Android)\n      if (error.code === 'PAYMENT_PENDING_ERROR') {\n        console.log('⏳ Payment pending');\n        throw new Error('PAYMENT_PENDING');\n      }\n\n      // Network error\n      if (error.code === 'NETWORK_ERROR') {\n        console.error('🌐 Network error during purchase');\n        throw new Error('Please check your internet connection and try again.');\n      }\n\n      // Generic error\n      console.error('❌ Purchase failed:', error);\n      throw new Error(error.message || 'Purchase failed. Please try again.');\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get customer info (includes entitlements and active subscriptions)\n   * @returns Customer info object\n   */\n  async getCustomerInfo(): Promise<CustomerInfo | null> {\n    if (!this.isInitialized) {\n      console.warn('⚠️ RevenueCat not initialized');\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      const customerInfo = await Purchases.getCustomerInfo();\n      return customerInfo;\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to get customer info:', error);\n      return null;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Check if user has active premium subscription\n   * @returns true if user has premium entitlement\n   */\n  async hasActivePremium(): Promise<boolean> {\n    try {\n      const customerInfo = await this.getCustomerInfo();\n      if (!customerInfo) return false;\n\n      // Check if user has premium entitlement\n      const entitlement = customerInfo.entitlements.active[ENTITLEMENT_ID];\n      const hasAccess = entitlement !== undefined && entitlement !== null;\n\n      if (hasAccess) {\n        console.log('✅ User has premium access');\n      } else {\n        console.log('ℹ️ User does not have premium access');\n      }\n\n      return hasAccess;\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to check premium status:', error);\n      return false;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Restore purchases (required for iOS)\n   * @returns Customer info after restore\n   */\n  async restorePurchases(): Promise<CustomerInfo> {\n    try {\n      const customerInfo = await Purchases.restorePurchases();\n      console.log('✅ Purchases restored successfully');\n      return customerInfo;\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to restore purchases:', error);\n      throw new Error('Failed to restore purchases. Please try again.');\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get detailed subscription information\n   * @returns Subscription details object\n   */\n  async getSubscriptionDetails(): Promise<{\n    hasActiveSubscription: boolean;\n    productIdentifier: string | null;\n    expirationDate: string | null;\n    willRenew: boolean;\n    isInGracePeriod: boolean;\n  } | null> {\n    if (!this.isInitialized) {\n      console.warn('⚠️ RevenueCat not initialized');\n      return null;\n    }\n\n    try {\n      const customerInfo = await this.getCustomerInfo();\n      if (!customerInfo) return null;\n\n      const entitlement = customerInfo.entitlements.active[ENTITLEMENT_ID];\n\n      if (!entitlement) {\n        return {\n          hasActiveSubscription: false,\n          productIdentifier: null,\n          expirationDate: null,\n          willRenew: false,\n          isInGracePeriod: false,\n        };\n      }\n\n      return {\n        hasActiveSubscription: true,\n        productIdentifier: entitlement.productIdentifier,\n        expirationDate: entitlement.expirationDate,\n        willRenew: entitlement.willRenew,\n        isInGracePeriod: false,\n      };\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to get subscription details:', error);\n      return null;\n    }\n  }\n\n  /**\n   * Get management URL for subscription\n   * This is where users can manage their subscription in the App Store/Play Store\n   * @returns Management URL\n   */\n  async getManagementURL(): Promise<string> {\n    try {\n      const customerInfo = await this.getCustomerInfo();\n      return customerInfo?.managementURL || '';\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error('❌ Failed to get management URL:', error);\n      return '';\n    }\n  }\n}\n\n// Export singleton instance\nexport const revenueCatService = new RevenueCatService();\n","numLines":296,"startLine":1,"totalLines":296}},"sourceToolAssistantUUID":"a54d2432-3162-48ca-ab75-3db872279ebe"}
